HPO编号	名称(英文)	名称(中文)	定义(英文)	定义(中文)
HP:0000002	Abnormality of body height	身高异常	Deviation from the norm of height with respect to that which is expected according to age and gender norms.	校对中...
HP:0000003	Multicystic kidney dysplasia	多囊性肾发育不良	Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.	校对中...
HP:0000005	Mode of inheritance	遗传模式	The pattern in which a particular genetic trait or disorder is passed from one generation to the next.	校对中...
HP:0000006	Autosomal dominant inheritance	常染色体显性遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.	校对中...
HP:0000007	Autosomal recessive inheritance	常染色体隐性遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in individuals with two pathogenic alleles, either homozygotes (two copies of the same mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).	校对中...
HP:0000008	Abnormal morphology of female internal genitalia	女性内生殖器形态异常	An abnormality of the female internal genitalia.	校对中...
HP:0000009	Functional abnormality of the bladder	膀胱功能异常	Dysfunction of the urinary bladder.	校对中...
HP:0000010	Recurrent urinary tract infections	复发性尿路感染	Repeated infections of the urinary tract.	校对中...
HP:0000011	Neurogenic bladder	神经源性膀胱功能障碍	A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.	校对中...
HP:0000012	Urinary urgency	尿急	Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.	校对中...
HP:0000013	Hypoplasia of the uterus	子宫发育不良	Underdevelopment of the uterus.	校对中...
HP:0000014	Abnormality of the bladder	膀胱异常	An abnormality of the urinary bladder.	校对中...
HP:0000015	Bladder diverticulum	膀胱憩室	Diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.	校对中...
HP:0000016	Urinary retention	尿潴留	Inability to completely empty the urinary bladder during the process of urination.	校对中...
HP:0000017	Nocturia	夜尿症	Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.	校对中...
HP:0000019	Urinary hesitancy	排尿踌躇	Difficulty in beginning the process of urination.	校对中...
HP:0000020	Urinary incontinence	尿失禁	Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination.	校对中...
HP:0000021	Megacystis	巨膀胱症	Dilatation of the bladder postnatally.	校对中...
HP:0000022	Abnormality of male internal genitalia	男性内生殖器异常	An abnormality of the male internal genitalia.	校对中...
HP:0000023	Inguinal hernia	腹股沟疝	Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.	校对中...
HP:0000024	Prostatitis	前列腺炎	The presence of inflammation of the prostate.	校对中...
HP:0000025	Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia	男性内生殖器功能异常		
HP:0000026	Male hypogonadism	男性性腺功能减退症	Decreased functionality of the male gonad, i.e., of the testis, with reduced spermatogenesis or testosterone synthesis.	校对中...
HP:0000027	Azoospermia	无精症	Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen.	校对中...
HP:0000028	Cryptorchidism	隐睾	Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.	校对中...
HP:0000029	Testicular atrophy	睾丸萎缩	Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.	校对中...
HP:0000030	Testicular gonadoblastoma	睾丸性腺母细胞瘤	The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the testis.	校对中...
HP:0000031	Epididymitis	附睾炎	The presence of inflammation of the epididymis.	校对中...
HP:0000032	Abnormality of male external genitalia	男性外生殖器异常	An abnormality of male external genitalia.	校对中...
HP:0000033	Ambiguous genitalia, male	男性外阴性别不明	Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XY genetic gender.	校对中...
HP:0000034	Hydrocele testis	睾丸鞘膜积液	Accumulation of clear fluid in the between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.	校对中...
HP:0000035	Abnormal testis morphology	睾丸形态异常	An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).	校对中...
HP:0000036	Abnormal penis morphology	阴茎形态异常	Abnormality of the male external sex organ.	校对中...
HP:0000037	Male pseudohermaphroditism	男性假两性畸形	Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.	校对中...
HP:0000039	Epispadias	尿道上裂	Displacement of the urethral opening on the dorsal (superior) surface of the penis.	校对中...
HP:0000040	Long penis	长阴茎	Penile length more than 2 SD above the mean for age.	校对中...
HP:0000041	Chordee	阴茎下曲	Ventral, lateral, or ventrolateral bowing of the shaft and glans penis of more than 30 degrees.	校对中...
HP:0000042	Absent external genitalia	外生殖器缺如	Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.	校对中...
HP:0000044	Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism	低促性腺激素性性腺功能减退症	Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).	校对中...
HP:0000045	Abnormality of the scrotum	阴囊异常		
HP:0000046	Scrotal hypoplasia	阴囊发育不良		
HP:0000047	Hypospadias	尿道下裂	Abnormal position of urethral meatus on the ventral penile shaft (underside) characterized by displacement of the urethral meatus from the tip of the glans penis to the ventral surface of the penis, scrotum, or perineum.	校对中...
HP:0000048	Bifid scrotum	阴囊对裂	Midline indentation or cleft of the scrotum.	校对中...
HP:0000049	Shawl scrotum	披肩状阴囊	Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.	校对中...
HP:0000050	Hypoplastic male external genitalia	男性外生殖器发育不良	Underdevelopment of part or all of the male external reproductive organs (which include the penis, the scrotum and the urethra).	校对中...
HP:0000051	Perineal hypospadias	会阴型尿道下裂	Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.	校对中...
HP:0000052	Urethral atresia, male	男性尿道闭锁	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in males.	校对中...
HP:0000053	Macroorchidism	巨睾	The presence of abnormally large testes.	校对中...
HP:0000054	Micropenis	小阴茎	Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.	校对中...
HP:0000055	Abnormality of female external genitalia	女性外生殖器异常	An abnormality of the female external genitalia.	校对中...
HP:0000056	Abnormality of the clitoris	阴蒂异常	An abnormality of the clitoris.	校对中...

HP:0000059	Hypoplastic labia majora	大阴唇发育不良	Undergrowth of the outer labia.	校对中...

HP:0000061	Ambiguous genitalia, female	女性外阴性别不明	Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XX genetic gender.	校对中...
HP:0000062	Ambiguous genitalia	外阴性别不明	A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.	校对中...
HP:0000063	Fused labia minora	小阴唇融合	Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.	校对中...

HP:0000066	Labial hypoplasia	阴唇发育不良		
HP:0000067	Urethral atresia, female	女性尿道闭锁	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in females.	校对中...
HP:0000068	Urethral atresia	尿道闭锁	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.	校对中...
HP:0000069	Abnormality of the ureter	输尿管异常	An abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.	校对中...
HP:0000070	Ureterocele	输尿管囊肿	A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.	校对中...
HP:0000071	Ureteral stenosis	输尿管狭窄	The presence of a stenotic, i.e., constricted ureter.	校对中...
HP:0000072	Hydroureter	输尿管积水	The distention of the ureter with urine.	校对中...
HP:0000073	Ureteral duplication	输尿管重复	A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.	校对中...
HP:0000074	Ureteropelvic junction obstruction	肾盂输尿管连接部梗阻	Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.	校对中...
HP:0000075	Renal duplication	肾重复	A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the kidney is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.	校对中...
HP:0000076	Vesicoureteral reflux	膀胱输尿管返流	Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.	校对中...
HP:0000077	Abnormality of the kidney	肾脏异常	An abnormality of the kidney.	校对中...
HP:0000078	Abnormality of the genital system	生殖系统异常	An abnormality of the genital system.	校对中...
HP:0000079	Abnormality of the urinary system	泌尿系统异常	An abnormality of the urinary system.	校对中...
HP:0000080	Abnormality of reproductive system physiology	生殖系统生理机能异常	An abnormal functionality of the genital system.	校对中...
HP:0000081	Duplicated collecting system	集合管系统重复	A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.	校对中...
HP:0000083	Renal insufficiency	肾功能不全	A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.	校对中...
HP:0000085	Horseshoe kidney	马蹄肾	A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.	校对中...
HP:0000086	Ectopic kidney	异位肾	A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.	校对中...
HP:0000089	Renal hypoplasia	肾发育不全	Hypoplasia of the kidney.	校对中...
HP:0000090	Nephronophthisis	肾结核	Presence of cysts at the corticomedullary junction of the kidney in combination with tubulointerstitial fibrosis.	校对中...
HP:0000091	Abnormal renal tubule morphology	肾小管形态异常	An abnormality of the renal tubules.	校对中...
HP:0000092	Renal tubular atrophy	肾小管萎缩	The presence of renal tubules with thick redundant basement membranes, or a reduction of greater than 50% in tubular diameter compared to surrounding non-atrophic tubules.	校对中...
HP:0000093	Proteinuria	蛋白尿	Increased levels of protein in the urine.	校对中...
HP:0000095	Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology	肾小球形态异常	A structural anomaly of the glomerulus.	校对中...
HP:0000096	Glomerular sclerosis	肾小球硬化	Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus.	校对中...
HP:0000097	Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis	局灶节段性肾小球硬化	Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.	校对中...
HP:0000098	Tall stature	高身材	A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.	校对中...
HP:0000099	Glomerulonephritis	肾小球肾炎	Inflammation of the renal glomeruli.	校对中...
HP:0000100	Nephrotic syndrome	肾病综合征	Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.	校对中...
HP:0000103	Polyuria	多尿	An increased rate of urine production.	校对中...
HP:0000104	Renal agenesis	肾缺如	Agenesis, that is, failure of the kidney to develop during embryogenesis and development.	校对中...
HP:0000105	Enlarged kidney	肾脏肿大	An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.	校对中...

HP:0000110	Renal dysplasia	肾发育不良	The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.	校对中...
HP:0000111	Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia	肾小球球旁细胞肥大/增生	Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells.	校对中...

HP:0000113	Polycystic kidney dysplasia	多囊肾性发育不良	The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.	校对中...
HP:0000114	Proximal tubulopathy	近端肾小管病	Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.	校对中...

HP:0000119	Abnormality of the genitourinary system	泌尿生殖系统异常	The presence of any abnormality of the genitourinary system.	校对中...
HP:0000121	Nephrocalcinosis	肾钙质沉着症	Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.	校对中...
HP:0000122	Unilateral renal agenesis	单侧肾缺如	A unilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.	校对中...
HP:0000123	Nephritis	肾炎	The presence of inflammation affecting the kidney.	校对中...
HP:0000124	Renal tubular dysfunction	肾小管功能障碍	Abnormal function of the renal tubule. The basic functional unit of the kidney, the nephron, consists of a renal corpuscle attached to a renal tubule, with roughly 0.8 to 1.5 nephrons per adult kidney. The functions of the renal tubule include reabsorption of water, electrolytes, glucose, and amino acids and secretion of substances such as uric acid.	校对中...
HP:0000125	Pelvic kidney	盆腔肾	A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.	校对中...
HP:0000126	Hydronephrosis	肾积水	Severe distention of the kidney with dilation of the renal pelvis and calices.	校对中...
HP:0000127	Renal salt wasting	肾源性盐流失	A high concentration of one or more electrolytes in the urine in the presence of low serum concentrations of the electrolyte(s).	校对中...
HP:0000128	Renal potassium wasting	肾源性钾流失	High urine potassium in the presence of hypokalemia.	校对中...

HP:0000175	Cleft palate	腭裂	Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the palate resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).	校对中...
HP:0000176	Submucous cleft hard palate	黏膜下硬裂腭	Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.	校对中...

HP:0000179	Thick lower lip vermilion	厚下红唇	Increased thickness of the lower lip, leading to a prominent appearance of the lower lip. The height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the midline is more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000180	Lobulated tongue	分叶舌	Multiple indentations and/or elevations on the edge and/or surface of the tongue producing an irregular surface contour.	校对中...

HP:0000185	Cleft soft palate	软腭裂	Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.	校对中...
HP:0000187	Broad alveolar ridges	宽牙槽嵴

HP:0000190	Abnormal oral frenulum morphology	口腔系带形态异常	An abnormality of the lingual frenulum, that is of the small fold of mucous membrane that attaches the tongue to the floor of the mouth, or the presence of accessory frenula in the oral cavity.	校对中...
HP:0000191	Accessory oral frenulum	额外口腔系带	Extra fold of tissue extending from the alveolar ridge to the inner surface of the upper or lower lip.	校对中...
HP:0000193	Bifid uvula	悬雍垂裂	Uvula separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip.	校对中...

HP:0000197	Abnormal parotid gland morphology	腮腺形态异常	Any abnormality of the parotid glands, which are the salivary glands that are located in the subcutaneous tissues of the face overlying the mandibular ramus and anterior and inferior to the external ear.	校对中...
HP:0000198	Absence of Stensen duct	无腮腺导管		
HP:0000199	Tongue nodules	舌结节		
HP:0000200	Short lingual frenulum	舌系带过短	The presence of an abnormally short lingual frenulum.	校对中...
HP:0000201	Pierre-Robin sequence	皮埃尔 - 罗宾序列征	Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia), glossoptosis and cleft palate.	校对中...
HP:0000202	Oral cleft	口裂	The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.	校对中...
HP:0000204	Cleft upper lip	上唇裂	A gap in the upper lip. This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.	校对中...
HP:0000205	Pursed lips	撅起的嘴唇	An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.	校对中...
HP:0000206	Glossitis	舌炎	Inflammation of the tongue.	校对中...
HP:0000207	Triangular mouth	三角嘴	The presence of a triangular form of the mouth.	校对中...
HP:0000211	Trismus	张口受限	Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.	校对中...
HP:0000212	Gingival overgrowth	牙龈增生	Hyperplasia of the gingiva (that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown.	校对中...
HP:0000214	Lip telangiectasia	唇部毛细血管扩张	Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the lips.	校对中...
HP:0000215	Thick upper lip vermilion	厚上红唇	Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000216	Broad secondary alveolar ridge	宽恒牙槽嵴		
HP:0000217	Xerostomia	口腔干燥	Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.	校对中...
HP:0000218	High palate	高腭	Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000219	Thin upper lip vermilion	薄上唇红	Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000220	Velopharyngeal insufficiency	腭咽机能不全	Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.	校对中...
HP:0000221	Furrowed tongue	沟裂舌	Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue.	校对中...
HP:0000222	Gingival hyperkeratosis	牙龈角化过度	Hyperkeratosis of the gingiva.	校对中...
HP:0000223	Abnormality of taste sensation	味觉异常		
HP:0000224	Hypogeusia	味觉减退	A decreased ability to perceive flavor.	校对中...
HP:0000225	Gingival bleeding	牙龈出血	Hemorrhage affecting the gingiva.	校对中...
HP:0000227	Tongue telangiectasia	舌毛细血管扩张	Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue.	校对中...
HP:0000228	Oral cavity telangiectasia	口腔毛细管扩张	Presence of telangiectases in the oral cavity.	校对中...
HP:0000230	Gingivitis	牙龈炎	Inflammation of the gingiva.	校对中...
HP:0000232	Everted lower lip vermilion	下唇唇红外翻	An abnormal configuration of the lower lip such that it is turned outward i.e., everted, with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.	校对中...
HP:0000233	Thin vermilion border	下红唇薄	Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lip more than 2 SD below the mean, or apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lip in the frontal view. The vermilion is the red part of the lips (and confusingly, the vermilion itself is also often referred to as being equivalent the lips).	校对中...
HP:0000234	Abnormality of the head	头部异常	An abnormality of the head.	校对中...
HP:0000235	Abnormality of the fontanelles or cranial sutures	囟门或颅缝异常	Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments).	校对中...
HP:0000236	Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle	前囟异常	An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.	校对中...
HP:0000237	Small anterior fontanelle	小前囟	Abnormally decreased size of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.	校对中...
HP:0000238	Hydrocephalus	脑积水	Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.	校对中...
HP:0000239	Large fontanelles	大囟门	In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.	校对中...
HP:0000240	Abnormality of skull size	颅骨大小异常	Any abnormality of the size of the skull.	校对中...
HP:0000242	Parietal bossing	顶骨隆起	Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.	校对中...
HP:0000243	Trigonocephaly	三角头畸形	Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.	校对中...
HP:0000244	Brachyturricephaly	短尖头畸形	Abnormal vertical height of the skull and a shortening of its anterior-posterior length, frequently combined with malformations of the occipital region.	校对中...
HP:0000245	Abnormal paranasal sinus morphology	副鼻窦形态异常	Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.	校对中...
HP:0000246	Sinusitis	鼻窦炎	Inflammation of the paranasal sinuses owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.	校对中...
HP:0000248	Brachycephaly	短头畸形	An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a decreased anterior-posterior diameter. That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.	校对中...
HP:0000250	Dense calvaria	颅盖骨密度过高	An abnormal increase of density of the bones making up the calvaria.	校对中...
HP:0000252	Microcephaly	小头畸形	Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender.	校对中...
HP:0000253	Progressive microcephaly	渐进性小头畸形	Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.	校对中...
HP:0000255	Acute sinusitis	急性鼻窦炎	An acute form of sinusitis.	校对中...
HP:0000256	Macrocephaly	巨头畸形	Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium.	校对中...
HP:0000260	Wide anterior fontanel	前囟增宽	Enlargement of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.	校对中...
HP:0000262	Turricephaly	尖头畸形	Tall head relative to width and length.	校对中...
HP:0000263	Oxycephaly	锥形头	Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.	校对中...
HP:0000264	Abnormality of the mastoid	乳突异常	An abnormality of the mastoid process, which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.	校对中...
HP:0000265	Mastoiditis	乳突炎		
HP:0000267	Cranial asymmetry	颅骨不对称	Asymmetry of the bones of the skull.	校对中...
HP:0000268	Dolichocephaly	长头畸形	An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a increased anterior-posterior diameter, i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.	校对中...
HP:0000269	Prominent occiput	枕骨突出	Increased convexity of the occiput (posterior part of the skull).	校对中...
HP:0000270	Delayed cranial suture closure	颅缝闭合延迟	Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.	校对中...
HP:0000271	Abnormality of the face	脸部异常	An abnormality of the face.	校对中...
HP:0000272	Malar flattening	颧骨扁平	Underdevelopment of the malar prominence of the jugal bone (zygomatic bone in mammals), appreciated in profile, frontal view, and/or by palpation.	校对中...
HP:0000273	Facial grimacing	面部表情痛苦		
HP:0000274	Small face	小脸	A face that is short (HP:0011219) and narrow (HP:0000275).	校对中...
HP:0000275	Narrow face	脸狭窄	Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000276	Long face	长脸	Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000277	Abnormality of the mandible	下颌骨异常	Any abnormality of the mandible, the bone of the lower jaw.	校对中...

HP:0000280	Coarse facial features	面容粗糙	Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues.	校对中...
HP:0000282	Facial edema	面部水肿		
HP:0000283	Broad face	宽脸	Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective).	校对中...

HP:0000294	Low anterior hairline	前发际低	Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD below the mean. HP:0000308	Microretrognathia	下颌小且后移	A form of developmental hypoplasia of the mandible in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.	校对中...
HP:0000309	Abnormality of the midface	面中部异常	An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma and cheeks and malar region. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.	校对中...
HP:0000311	Round face	圆脸	The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.	校对中...
HP:0000315	Abnormality of the orbital region	眼眶异常		
HP:0000316	Hypertelorism	眼距过宽	Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes).	校对中...
HP:0000317	Facial myokymia	面肌颤搐	Facial myokymia is a fine fibrillary activity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).	校对中...

HP:0000346	Whistling appearance	吹口哨面容	An abnormality of facial morphology characterized by a small mouth opening and constant contraction of the lips as if the patient were whistling.	校对中...

HP:0000348	High forehead	额头高	An abnormally increased height of the forehead.	校对中...
HP:0000349	Widow's peak	美人尖	Frontal hairline with bilateral arcs to a low point in the midline of the forehead.	校对中...
HP:0000350	Small forehead	小额头	The presence of a forehead that is abnormally small.	校对中...

HP:0000358	Posteriorly rotated ears	后旋耳	A type of abnormal location of the ears in which the position of the ears is characterized by posterior rotation (the superior part of the ears is rotated towards the back of the head, and the inferior part of the ears towards the front).	校对中...
HP:0000359	Abnormality of the inner ear	内耳异常	An abnormality of the inner ear.	校对中...
HP:0000360	Tinnitus	耳鸣	Tinnitus is an auditory perception that can be described as the experience of sound, in the ear or in the head, in the absence of external acoustic stimulation.	校对中...
HP:0000362	Otosclerosis	耳硬化症	In otosclerosis, a callus of bone accumulates on the stapes creating a partial fixation. This limits the movement of the stapes bone, which results in hearing loss.	校对中...

HP:0000376	Incomplete partition of the cochlea type II	II型耳蜗分隔不全	IWith incomplete partition II, the cochlea consists of 1.5 turns; the apical and middle cochlea turns are undifferentiated and form a cystic apex. The vestibule is normal while the vestibular aqueduct is always enlarged. Developmental arrest occurs at the seventh week of gestation.	校对中...
HP:0000377	Abnormality of the pinna	耳廓异常	An abnormality of the pinna, which is also referred to as the auricle or external ear.	校对中...
HP:0000378	Cupped ear	杯状耳	Laterally protruding ear that lacks antihelical folding (including absence of inferior and superior crura).	校对中...
HP:0000381	Stapes ankylosis	镫骨固定	Stapes ankylosis refers to congenital or acquired fixation of the stapes (the stirrup-shaped small bone or ossicle in the middle ear), which is associated with conductive hearing resulting from impairment of the sound-conduction mechanism (the external auditory canal, tympanic membrane, and/or middle-ear ossicles).	校对中...
HP:0000383	Abnormality of periauricular region	耳周区异常

HP:0000396	Overfolded helix	耳轮过度卷曲	A condition in which the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal. That is, excessive curling of the helix edge, whereby the free edge is parallel to the plane of the ear.	校对中...
HP:0000399	Prelingual sensorineural hearing impairment	学语前感音神经性听力损失	A form of sensorineural deafness with either congenital onset or infantile onset, i.e., before the acquisition of speech.	校对中...
HP:0000400	Macrotia	巨耳畸形	Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000402	Stenosis of the external auditory canal	外耳道狭窄	An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.	校对中...

HP:0000405	Conductive hearing impairment	传导性听力障碍	An abnormality of vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear leading to impairment of sensory perception of sound.	校对中...

HP:0000410	Mixed hearing impairment	混合性听力损失	A type of hearing loss resulting from a combination of conductive hearing impairment and sensorineural hearing impairment.	校对中...
HP:0000411	Protruding ear	招风耳	Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).	校对中...

HP:0000421	Epistaxis	鼻衄	Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a hemorrhage localized in the nose.	校对中...
HP:0000422	Abnormal nasal bridge morphology	鼻梁形态异常	Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.	校对中...

HP:0000451	Triangular nasal tip	三角鼻尖		
HP:0000452	Choanal stenosis	鼻后孔狭窄	Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).	校对中...

HP:0000457	Depressed nasal ridge	鼻嵴凹陷	Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.	校对中...
HP:0000458	Anosmia	嗅觉丧失	An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.	校对中...
HP:0000460	Narrow nose	鼻缩窄	Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae.	校对中...
HP:0000463	Anteverted nares	鼻孔前翻	Anteriorly-facing nostrils viewed with the head in the Frankfurt horizontal and the eyes of the observer level with the eyes of the subject. This gives the appearance of an upturned nose (upturned nasal tip).	校对中...
HP:0000464	Abnormality of the neck	颈部异常	An abnormality of the neck.	校对中...
HP:0000465	Webbed neck	蹼颈	Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.	校对中...
HP:0000466	Limited neck range of motion	颈部运动范围受限

HP:0000473	Torticollis	斜颈	Involuntary contractions of the neck musculature resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.	校对中...
HP:0000474	Thickened nuchal skin fold	颈部皮肤皱襞增厚	A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (PMID:16100637).	校对中...
HP:0000475	Broad neck	宽颈	Increased side-to-side width of the neck.	校对中...

HP:0000478	Abnormality of the eye	眼部异常	Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.	校对中...
HP:0000479	Abnormal retinal morphology	视网膜形态异常	A structural abnormality of the retina.	校对中...
HP:0000480	Retinal coloboma	视网膜缺损	A notch or cleft of the retina.	校对中...
HP:0000481	Abnormal cornea morphology	角膜形态异常	Any abnormality of the cornea, which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.	校对中...
HP:0000482	Microcornea	小角膜	A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.	校对中...
HP:0000483	Astigmatism	散光	A type of astigmatism associated with abnormal curvatures on the anterior and/or posterior surface of the cornea.	校对中...
HP:0000484	Hyperopic astigmatism	远视散光	A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.	校对中...
HP:0000485	Megalocornea	巨角膜	An enlargement of the cornea with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.	校对中...
HP:0000486	Strabismus	斜视	A misalignment of the eyes so that the visual axes deviate from bifoveal fixation. The classification of strabismus may be based on a number of features including the relative position of the eyes, whether the deviation is latent or manifest, intermittent or constant, concomitant or otherwise and according to the age of onset and the relevance of any associated refractive error.	校对中...
HP:0000488	Retinopathy	视网膜病变	Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.	校对中...
HP:0000490	Deeply set eye	眼睛深陷	An eye that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.	校对中...

HP:0000494	Downslanted palpebral fissures	下斜睑裂	The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.	校对中...

HP:0000504	Abnormality of vision	视力异常	Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception).	校对中...
HP:0000505	Visual impairment	视觉障碍	Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.	校对中...
HP:0000506	Telecanthus	内眦距过宽	Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.	校对中...
HP:0000508	Ptosis	上睑下垂	The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).	校对中...
HP:0000509	Conjunctivitis	结膜炎	Inflammation of the conjunctiva.	校对中...
HP:0000510	Rod-cone dystrophy	杆锥体营养不良	An inherited retinal disease subtype in which the rod photoreceptors appear to be more severely affected than the cone photoreceptors. Typical presentation is with nyctalopia (due to rod dysfunction) followed by loss of mid-peripheral field of vision, which gradually extends and leaves many patients with a small central island of vision due to the preservation of macular cones.	校对中...
HP:0000511	Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy	垂直性核上性凝视麻痹	A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.	校对中...
HP:0000512	Abnormal electroretinogram	视网膜电图异常	Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.	校对中...

HP:0000519	Developmental cataract	发育性白内障	A cataract that occurs congenitally as the result of a developmental defect, in contrast to the majority of cataracts that occur in adulthood as the result of degenerative changes of the lens.	校对中...
HP:0000520	Proptosis	眼球突出	An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.	校对中...
HP:0000522	Alacrima	无泪	Absence of tear secretion.	校对中...

HP:0000580	Pigmentary retinopathy	色素性视网膜病	An abnormality of the retina characterized by pigment deposition. It is typically associated with migration and proliferation of macrophages or retinal pigment epithelial cells into the retina; melanin from these cells causes the pigmentary changes. Pigmentary retinopathy is a common final pathway of many retinal conditions and is often associated with visual loss.	校对中...

HP:0000641	Dysmetric saccades	不规则扫视	The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.	校对中...

HP:0000657	Oculomotor apraxia	眼球运动失用	Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.	校对中...

HP:0000694	Odontodysplasia	空壳牙	The diagnosis odontodysplasia requires clinical and radiological exams, in which unusually large pulp chambers and large pulp room chambers with thin enamel and dentin are visible. It may affect either a single tooth or several teeth. The term regional odontodysplasia is used if several teeth are affected. It affects the deciduous and permanent dentitions in the maxilla, the mandible or both, although the maxilla is more frequently involved. A type of dental dysplasia occurring in dentinogenesis imperfecta in which the pulp chambers are enlarged and there is a reduced amount of coronal dentin.	校对中...

HP:0000717	Autism	孤独症	Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).	校对中...
HP:0000718	Aggressive behavior	攻击性行为	Aggressive behavior can denote verbal aggression, physical aggression against objects, physical aggression against people, and may also include aggression towards oneself.	校对中...

HP:0000732	Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals	恪守程序或习惯		
HP:0000733	Stereotypy	刻板性	A stereotypy is a repetitive, simple movement that can be voluntarily suppressed. Stereotypies are typically simple back-and-forth movements such as waving of flapping the hands or arms, and they do not involve complex sequences or movement fragments. Movement is often but not always rhythmic and may involve fingers, wrists, or more proximal portions of the upper extremity. The lower extremity is not typically involved. Stereotypies are more commonly bilateral than unilateral.	校对中...

Although it is difficult to define normal age ranges because of the marked variation with which puberty begins in normal children, precocious puberty can be defined as the onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls or 9 years in boys.	校对中...

HP:0000830	Anterior hypopituitarism	垂体前叶功能减退症	A condition of reduced function of the anterior pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone.	校对中...
HP:0000831	Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus	胰岛素抵抗性糖尿病	A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as will as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels.	校对中...
HP:0000832	Primary hypothyroidism	原发性甲状腺功能减退症	A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in the thyroid gland.	校对中...
HP:0000834	Abnormality of the adrenal glands	肾上腺异常	Abnormality of the adrenal glands, i.e., of the endocrine glands located at the top of the kindneys.	校对中...
HP:0000835	Adrenal hypoplasia	肾上腺发育不良	Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal glands.	校对中...
HP:0000836	Hyperthyroidism	甲状腺功能亢进症	An abnormality of thyroid physiology characterized by excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones thyroxine (i.e., T4) and/or 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3).	校对中...
HP:0000837	Increased circulating gonadotropin level	促性腺激素水平升高	Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.	校对中...
HP:0000839	Pituitary dwarfism	垂体性侏儒症	A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.	校对中...
HP:0000840	Adrenogenital syndrome	肾上腺性征异常综合征	Adrenogenital syndrome is also known as congenital adrenal hyperplasia, which results from disorders of steroid hormone production in the adrenal glands leading to a deficiency of cortisol. The pituitary gland reacts by increased secretion of corticotropin, which in turn causes the adrenal glands to overproduce certain intermediary hormones which have testosterone-like effects.	校对中...
HP:0000841	Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system	肾素-血管紧张素系统亢进	An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.	校对中...
HP:0000842	Hyperinsulinemia	高胰岛素血症	An increased concentration of insulin in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0000843	Hyperparathyroidism	甲状旁腺功能亢进症	Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.	校对中...
HP:0000845	Elevated circulating growth hormone concentration	生长激素水平升高	Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.	校对中...
HP:0000846	Adrenal insufficiency	肾上腺功能不全	Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands.	校对中...
HP:0000847	Abnormality of renin-angiotensin system	肾素-血管紧张素系统异常	An abnormality of the renin-angiotensin system.	校对中...

HP:0000849	Adrenocortical abnormality	肾上腺皮质异常

HP:0000852	Pseudohypoparathyroidism	假性甲状旁腺功能减退症	A condition characterized by resistance to the action of parathyroid hormone, in which there is hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and (appropriately) high levels of parathyroid hormone.	校对中...
HP:0000853	Goiter	甲状腺肿	An enlargement of the thyroid gland.	校对中...
HP:0000854	Thyroid adenoma	甲状腺腺瘤	The presence of a adenoma of the thyroid gland.	校对中...
HP:0000855	Insulin resistance	胰岛素抵抗	Increased resistance towards insulin, that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.	校对中...

HP:0000860	Parathyroid hypoplasia	甲状旁腺发育不全	Developmental hypoplasia of the parathyroid gland.	校对中...
HP:0000863	Central diabetes insipidus	中枢性尿崩症	A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.	校对中...
HP:0000864	Abnormality of the hypothalamus-pituitary axis	下丘脑-垂体轴异常	Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.	校对中...
HP:0000866	Euthyroid multinodular goiter	甲状腺功能正常结节性甲状腺肿		
HP:0000867	Secondary hyperparathyroidism	继发性甲状旁腺功能亢进症	Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.	校对中...
HP:0000868	Decreased fertility in females	女性生育能力降低		
HP:0000869	Secondary amenorrhea	继发性闭经		
HP:0000870	Increased circulating prolactin concentration	泌乳素水平升高	The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy.	校对中...
HP:0000871	Panhypopituitarism	全垂体功能减退	A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin).	校对中...
HP:0000872	Hashimoto thyroiditis	桥本甲状腺炎	A chronic, autoimmune type of thyroiditis associated with hypothyroidism.	校对中...
HP:0000873	Diabetes insipidus	尿崩症	A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).	校对中...

HP:0000938	Osteopenia	骨质减少	Osteopenia is a term to define bone density that is not normal but also not as low as osteoporosis. By definition from the World Health Organization osteopenia is defined by bone densitometry as a T score -1 to -2.5.	校对中...
HP:0000939	Osteoporosis	骨质疏松	Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO criteria, osteoporosis is defined as a BMD that lies 2.5 standard deviations or more below the average value for young healthy adults (a T-score below -2.5 SD).	校对中...
HP:0000940	Abnormal diaphysis morphology	骨干形态异常	An abnormality of the structure or form of the diaphysis, i.e., of the main or mid-section (shaft) of a long bone.	校对中...

HP:0000951	Abnormality of the skin	皮肤异常	An abnormality of the skin.	校对中...

HP:0000962	Hyperkeratosis	角化过度	Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the outer layer of the skin, the stratum corneum, which is composed of large, polyhedral, plate-like envelopes filled with keratin which are the dead cells that have migrated up from the stratum granulosum.	校对中...
HP:0000963	Thin skin	皮肤变薄	Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.	校对中...
HP:0000964	Eczema	湿疹	Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding.	校对中...
HP:0000965	Cutis marmorata	大理石样皮肤	A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.	校对中...
HP:0000966	Hypohidrosis	少汗症	Abnormally diminished capacity to sweat.	校对中...
HP:0000967	Petechiae	瘀点	Petechiae are pinpoint-sized reddish/purple spots, resembling a rash, that appear just under the skin or a mucous membrane when capillaries have ruptured and some superficial bleeding into the skin has happened. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae.	校对中...
HP:0000968	Ectodermal dysplasia	外胚层发育不良	Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands.	校对中...
HP:0000969	Edema	水肿	An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.	校对中...
HP:0000970	Anhidrosis	无汗症	Inability to sweat.	校对中...
HP:0000971	Abnormal sweat gland morphology	汗腺异常	Any structural abnormality of the sweat gland.	校对中...
HP:0000972	Palmoplantar hyperkeratosis	掌跖角化	Abnormal thickening of the skin localized to the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot.	校对中...

HP:0000975	Hyperhidrosis	多汗症	Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating) despite the lack of appropriate stimuli like hot and humid weather.	校对中...
HP:0000976	Eczematoid dermatitis	湿疹样皮炎		
HP:0000977	Soft skin	皮肤柔软	Subjective impression of increased softness upon palpitation of the skin.	校对中...
HP:0000978	Bruising susceptibility	瘀斑易感性	An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.	校对中...
HP:0000979	Purpura	紫癜	Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning "purple") is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.	校对中...
HP:0000980	Pallor	苍白圈	Abnormally pale skin.	校对中...
HP:0000982	Palmoplantar keratoderma	掌跖角化症	Abnormal thickening of the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.	校对中...

HP:0000989	Pruritus	瘙痒	Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased disposition to experience pruritus.	校对中...
HP:0000991	Xanthomatosis	黄瘤病	The presence of multiple xanthomas (xanthomata) in the skin. Xanthomas are yellowish, firm, lipid-laden nodules in the skin.	校对中...
HP:0000992	Cutaneous photosensitivity	光感性皮肤	An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.	校对中...
HP:0000993	Molluscoid pseudotumors	软假瘤	Bluish-grey, spongy nodules associated with scars over pressure points and easily traumatized areas like the elbows and knees.	校对中...
HP:0000995	Melanocytic nevus	黑素细胞痣	A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.	校对中...
HP:0000996	Facial capillary hemangioma	面部毛细血管瘤	Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells with small endothelial spaces, occurring in the face.	校对中...
HP:0000997	Axillary freckling	腋窝雀斑	The presence in the axillary region (armpit) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.	校对中...
HP:0000998	Hypertrichosis	多毛症	Hypertrichosis is increased hair growth that is abnormal in quantity or location.	校对中...
HP:0000999	Pyoderma	脓皮病	Any manifestation of a skin disease associated with the production of pus.	校对中...
HP:0001000	Abnormality of skin pigmentation	皮肤着色异常	An abnormality of the pigmentation of the skin.	校对中...

HP:0001004	Lymphedema	淋巴水肿	Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system.	校对中...
HP:0001005	Dermatological manifestations of systemic disorders	系统性疾病的皮肤表现		
HP:0001007	Hirsutism	多毛症；女性多毛症	Abnormally increased hair growth referring to a male pattern of body hair (androgenic hair).	校对中...
HP:0001008	Accumulation of melanosomes in melanocytes	黑素细胞中黑素小体聚集		
HP:0001009	Telangiectasia	毛细血管扩张	Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.	校对中...
HP:0001010	Hypopigmentation of the skin	皮肤色素减退	A reduction of skin color related to a decrease in melanin production and deposition.	校对中...
HP:0001012	Multiple lipomas	多发性脂肪瘤	The presence of multiple lipomas (a type of benign tissue made of fatty tissue).	校对中...
HP:0001013	Eruptive xanthomas	发疹性黄瘤	Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur.	校对中...
HP:0001014	Angiokeratoma	血管角皮瘤	A vascular lesion defined histologically as one or more dilated blood vessels lying directly subepidermal and showing an epidermal proliferative reaction. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.	校对中...
HP:0001015	Prominent superficial veins	浅表静脉隆凸	A condition in which superficial veins (i.e., veins just under the skin) are more conspicuous or noticable than normal.	校对中...
HP:0001017	Anemic pallor	贫血性白斑	A type of pallor that is secondary to the presence of anemia.	校对中...
HP:0001018	Abnormal palmar dermatoglyphics	手掌皮纹异常	An abnormality of the dermatoglyphs, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of palm of hand.	校对中...
HP:0001019	Erythroderma	剥脱性皮炎	An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever.	校对中...
HP:0001022	Albinism	白化病	An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of skin, hair and eye (iris and retina).	校对中...
HP:0001024	Skin dimple over apex of long bone angulation	长骨角顶点处的皮肤酒窝征		
HP:0001025	Urticaria	荨麻疹	Raised, well-circumscribed areas of erythema and edema involving the dermis and epidermis. Urticaria is intensely pruritic, and blanches completely with pressure.	校对中...
HP:0001026	Penetrating foot ulcers	足部穿通性溃疡		
HP:0001027	Soft, doughy skin	面团样柔性皮肤	A skin texture that is unusually soft (and may feel silky), and has a malleable consistency resembling that of dough.	校对中...
HP:0001028	Hemangioma	血管瘤	A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).	校对中...
HP:0001029	Poikiloderma	皮肤异色症	Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias.	校对中...
HP:0001030	Fragile skin	敏感性皮肤	Skin that splits easily with minimal injury.	校对中...

HP:0001032	Absent distal interphalangeal creases	远端指间关节皮肤皱褶缺如	Absence of the distal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fingers.	校对中...
HP:0001033	Facial flushing after alcohol intake	酒后面部潮红		
HP:0001034	Hypermelanotic macule	色素沉着斑	A hyperpigmented circumscribed area of change in normal skin color without elevation or depression of any size.	校对中...
HP:0001036	Parakeratosis	角化不全	Abnormal formation of the keratinocytes of the epidermis characterized by persistence of nuclei, incomplete formation of keratin, and moistness and swelling of the keratinocytes.	校对中...
HP:0001038	Warfarin-induced skin necrosis	华法林诱导性皮肤坏死

HP:0001047	Atopic dermatitis	特应性皮炎	Atopic dermatitis (AD) or atopic eczema is an itchy, inflammatory skin condition with a predilection for the skin flexures. It is characterized by poorly defined erythema with edema, vesicles, and weeping in the acute stage and skin thickening (lichenification) in the chronic stage.	校对中...
HP:0001048	Cavernous hemangioma	海绵状血管瘤	The presence of a cavernous hemangioma. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma.	校对中...

HP:0001050	Plethora	多血症（红细胞增多症）		
HP:0001051	Seborrheic dermatitis	脂溢性皮炎	Seborrheic dermatitis is a form of eczema which is closely related to dandruff. It causes dry or greasy peeling of the scalp, eyebrows, and face, and sometimes trunk.	校对中...
HP:0001052	Nevus flammeus	鲜红斑痣	A congenital vascular malformation consisting of superficial and deep dilated capillaries in the skin which produce a reddish to purplish discolouration of the skin.	校对中...
HP:0001053	Hypopigmented skin patches	皮肤色素减退斑

HP:0001056	Milia	粟丘疹	Presence of multiple small cysts containing keratin (skin protein) and presenting as tiny pearly-white bumps just under the surface of the skin.	校对中...
HP:0001057	Aplasia cutis congenita	先天性表皮发育不全	A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin in multiple or solitary non-inflammatory, well-demarcated, oval or circular ulcers with a diameter of about 1 to 2 cm. Aplasia cutis congenita most commonly occurs on the scalp, but may present in the face, trunk, or limbs.	校对中...
HP:0001058	Poor wound healing	伤口愈合不良	A reduced ability to heal cutaneous wounds.	校对中...

HP:0001061	Acne	痤疮	A skin condition in which there is an increase in sebum secretion by the pilosebaceous apparatus associated with open comedones (blackheads), closed comedones (whiteheads), and pustular nodules (papules, pustules, and cysts).	校对中...
HP:0001062	Atypical nevus	非典型痣（&gt;5毫米且有不规则的边缘及色素沉着）	A large pigmented lesion measuring 5-15 mm in diameter with irregular, notched, and ill defined border and with color that may range from tan to dark brown to pink.	校对中...
HP:0001063	Acrocyanosis	手足发绀		
HP:0001065	Striae distensae	萎缩纹	Thinned, erythematous, depressed bands of atrophic skin. Initially, striae appear as flattened and thinned, pinkish linear regions of the skin. Striae tend to enlarge in length and become reddish or purplish. Later, striae tend to appear as white, depressed bands that are parallel to the lines of skin tension. Striae distensae occur most often in areas that have been subject to distension such as the lower back, buttocks, thighs, breast, abdomen, and shoulders.	校对中...

HP:0001080	Biliary tract abnormality	胆道异常	An abnormality of the biliary tree.	校对中...

HP:0001082	Cholecystitis	胆囊炎	The presence of inflammatory changes in the gallbladder.	校对中...
HP:0001083	Ectopia lentis	晶状体异位	Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation.	校对中...
HP:0001084	Corneal arcus	角膜环	A hazy, grayish-white ring about 2 mm in width located close to but separated from the limbus (the corneoscleral junction). Corneal arcus generally occurs bilaterally, and is related to lipid deposition in the cornea. Corneal arcus can occur in elderly persons as a part of the aging process but may be associated with hypercholesterolemia in people under the age of 50 years.	校对中...
HP:0001085	Papilledema	视乳头水肿	Papilledema refers to edema (swelling) of the optic disc secondary to any factor which increases cerebral spinal fluid pressure.	校对中...

HP:0001097	Keratoconjunctivitis sicca	干燥性角结膜炎	Dryness of the eye related to deficiency of the tear film components (aqueous, mucin, or lipid), lid surface abnormalities, or epithelial abnormalities. Keratoconjunctivitis sicca often results in a scratchy or sandy sensation (foreign body sensation) in the eyes, and may also be associated with itching, inability to produce tears, photosensitivity, redness, pain, and difficulty in moving the eyelids.	校对中...
HP:0001098	Abnormal fundus morphology	眼底形态异常	Any structural abnormality of the fundus of the eye.	校对中...

HP:0001102	Angioid streaks of the fundus	眼底血管样条纹	Irregular lines in the deep retina that are typically configured in a radiating fashion and emanate from the optic disc. Angioid streaks are crack-like dehiscences in abnormally thickened and calcified Bruch's membrane, resulting in atrophy of the overlying retinal pigment epithelium. They may be associated with a number of endocrine, metabolic, and connective tissue abnormalities but are frequently idiopathic.	校对中...
HP:0001103	Abnormal macular morphology	黄斑形态异常	A structural abnormality of the macula lutea, which is an oval-shaped highly pigmented yellow spot near the center of the retina.	校对中...

HP:0001115	Posterior polar cataract	后极性白内障	A polar cataract that affects the posterior pole of the lens.	校对中...
HP:0001116	Macular coloboma	黄斑缺损	A congenital defect of the macula distinct from coloboma associated with optic fissure closure defects. HP:0001147	Retinal exudate	视网膜渗出	Fluid which has escaped from retinal blood vessels with a high concentration of lipid, protein, and cellular debris with a typically bright, reflective, white or cream colored appearance on the surface of the retina.	校对中...
HP:0001149	Lattice corneal dystrophy	格子样角膜营养不良	The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman's layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet's membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea.	校对中...
HP:0001151	Impaired horizontal smooth pursuit	水平平滑追随眼动受损	An abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit characterized by an impairment of the ability to track horizontally moving objects.	校对中...
HP:0001152	Saccadic smooth pursuit	扫视平滑追视	An abnormality of tracking eye movements in which smooth pursuit is interrupted by an abnormally high number of saccadic movements.	校对中...
HP:0001153	Septate vagina	阴道纵膈	The presence of a vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication. The septum is longitudinal in the majority of cases.	校对中...

HP:0001156	Brachydactyly	短指（趾）	Digits that appear disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot. The word brachydactyly is used here to describe a series distinct patterns of shortened digits (brachydactyly types A-E). This is the sense used here.	校对中...
HP:0001159	Syndactyly	并指（趾）畸形	Webbing or fusion of the fingers or toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers or toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "symphalangism".	校对中...
HP:0001161	Hand polydactyly	多指	A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary finger or fingers.	校对中...

HP:0001167	Abnormality of finger	手指异常	An anomaly of a finger.	校对中...
HP:0001169	Broad palm	宽掌	For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.	校对中...
HP:0001171	Split hand	手劈裂	A condition in which middle parts of the hand (fingers and metacarpals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middel fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.	校对中...
HP:0001172	Abnormal thumb morphology	拇指形态异常	An abnormal structure of the first digit of the hand.	校对中...
HP:0001176	Large hands	巨手		
HP:0001177	Preaxial hand polydactyly	轴前多指	Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.	校对中...
HP:0001178	Ulnar claw	尺侧爪形手	An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.	校对中...
HP:0001180	Hand oligodactyly	少指畸形	A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of fingers.	校对中...
HP:0001181	Adducted thumb	拇指内收	In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.	校对中...
HP:0001182	Tapered finger	锥形指	The gradual reduction in girth of the finger from proximal to distal.	校对中...
HP:0001187	Hyperextensibility of the finger joints	指间关节过伸	The ability of the finger joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.	校对中...
HP:0001188	Hand clenching	攥拳手	An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints.	校对中...
HP:0001191	Abnormality of the carpal bones	腕骨异常	An abnormality affecting the carpal bones of the wrist (scaphoid, lunate, triquetral, pisiform, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate).	校对中...

HP:0001194	Abnormalities of placenta or umbilical cord	胎盘和脐带的异常	An abnormality of the placenta (the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall) or of the umbilical cord (the cord that connects the fetus to the placenta).	校对中...

HP:0001199	Triphalangeal thumb	三指节拇指	A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.	校对中...
HP:0001204	Distal symphalangism of hands	远端指间关节融合	The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.	校对中...

HP:0001241	Capitate-hamate fusion	头状骨-钩骨融合
