HP:0001250	Seizure	癫痫发作	A seizure is an intermittent abnormality of nervous system physiology characterised by a transient occurrence of signs and/or symptoms due to abnormal excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.	校对中...
HP:0001251	Ataxia	共济失调	Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- or overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).	校对中...
HP:0001252	Hypotonia	肌张力减退	Hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle). Even when relaxed, muscles have a continuous and passive partial contraction which provides some resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia thus manifests as diminished resistance to passive stretching. Hypotonia is not the same as muscle weakness, although the two conditions can co-exist.	校对中...
HP:0001254	Lethargy	昏睡	A state of disinterestedness, listlessness, and indifference, resulting in difficulty performing simple tasks or concentrating.	校对中...
HP:0001256	Intellectual disability, mild	轻度智力残疾	Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69.	校对中...
HP:0001257	Spasticity	痉挛	A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes.	校对中...
HP:0001258	Spastic paraplegia	痉挛性截瘫	Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles.	校对中...
HP:0001259	Coma	昏迷	Complete absence of wakefulness and content of conscience, which manifests itself as a lack of response to any kind of external stimuli.	校对中...
HP:0001260	Dysarthria	构音障碍	Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.	校对中...
HP:0001262	Excessive daytime somnolence	日间睡眠增多	A state of abnormally strong desire for sleep during the daytime.	校对中...
HP:0001263	Global developmental delay	全面发育迟缓	A delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child, including motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and emotional skills. This term should only be used to describe children younger than five years of age.	校对中...
HP:0001264	Spastic diplegia	痉挛性双侧瘫痪	Spasticity (neuromuscular hypertonia) primarily in the muscles of the legs, hips, and pelvis.	校对中...
HP:0001265	Hyporeflexia	腱反射减弱	Reduction of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.	校对中...
HP:0001266	Choreoathetosis	舞蹈手足徐动	Involuntary movements characterized by both athetosis (inability to sustain muscles in a fixed position) and chorea (widespread jerky arrhythmic movements).	校对中...
HP:0001268	Mental deterioration	智能衰退	Loss of previously present mental abilities, generally in adults.	校对中...
HP:0001269	Hemiparesis	轻偏瘫	Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength.	校对中...
HP:0001270	Motor delay	运动发育迟缓	A type of Developmental delay characterized by a delay in acquiring motor skills.	校对中...
HP:0001271	Polyneuropathy	多发性神经病	A generalized disorder of peripheral nerves.	校对中...
HP:0001272	Cerebellar atrophy	小脑萎缩	Cerebellar atrophy is defined as a cerebellum with initially normal structures, in a posterior fossa with normal size, which displays enlarged fissures (interfolial spaces) in comparison to the foliae secondary to loss of tissue. Cerebellar atrophy implies irreversible loss of tissue and result from an ongoing progressive disease until a final stage is reached or a single injury, e.g. an intoxication or infectious event.	校对中...
HP:0001273	Abnormal corpus callosum morphology	胼胝体形态异常	Abnormality of the corpus callosum.	校对中...
HP:0001274	Agenesis of corpus callosum	胼胝体发育不全	Absence of the corpus callosum as a result of the failure of the corpus callosum to develop, which can be the result of a failure in any one of the multiple steps of callosal development including cellular proliferation and migration, axonal growth or glial patterning at the midline.	校对中...
HP:0001276	Hypertonia	肌张力增高	A condition in which there is increased muscle tone so that arms or legs, for example, are stiff and difficult to move.	校对中...
HP:0001278	Orthostatic hypotension	体位性低血压	A form of hypotension characterized by a sudden fall in blood pressure that occurs when a person assumes a standing position.	校对中...
HP:0001279	Syncope	晕厥	Syncope refers to a generalized weakness of muscles with loss of postural tone, inability to stand upright, and loss of consciousness. Once the patient is in a horizontal position, blood flow to the brain is no longer hindered by gravitation and consciousness is regained. Unconsciousness usually lasts for seconds to minutes. Headache and drowsiness (which usually follow seizures) do not follow a syncopal attack. Syncope results from a sudden impairment of brain metabolism usually due to a reduction in cerebral blood flow.	校对中...
HP:0001281	Tetany	手足抽搐	A condition characterized by intermittent involuntary contraction of muscles (spasms) related to hypocalcemia or occasionally magnesium deficiency.	校对中...
HP:0001283	Bulbar palsy	球麻痹	Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia.	校对中...
HP:0001284	Areflexia	神经反射消失	Absence of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.	校对中...
HP:0001285	Spastic tetraparesis	痉挛性四肢瘫	Spastic weakness affecting all four limbs.	校对中...
HP:0001287	Meningitis	脑膜炎	Inflammation of the meninges.	校对中...
HP:0001288	Gait disturbance	步态不稳	The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk. In general, this can refer to neurological diseases but also fractures or other sources of pain that is triggered upon walking. However, in the current context gait disturbance refers to difficulty walking on the basis of a neurological or muscular disease.	校对中...
HP:0001289	Confusion	意识模糊	Lack of clarity and coherence of thought, perception, understanding, or action.	校对中...
HP:0001290	Generalized hypotonia	全身性肌张力减低	Generalized muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone).	校对中...
HP:0001291	Abnormal cranial nerve morphology	颅神经形态异常	Structural abnormality affecting one or more of the cranial nerves, which emerge directly from the brain stem.	校对中...
HP:0001293	Cranial nerve compression	颅神经受压		
HP:0001297	Stroke	卒中	Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.	校对中...
HP:0001298	Encephalopathy	脑病	Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state.	校对中...
HP:0001300	Parkinsonism	帕金森症	Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting from degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait.	校对中...
HP:0001301	Chronic sensorineural polyneuropathy	慢性多发性感觉神经病		
HP:0001302	Pachygyria	巨脑回	Pachygyria is a malformation of cortical development with abnormally wide gyri with sulci 1,5-3 cm apart and abnormally thick cortex measuring more than 5 mm (radiological definition). See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.	校对中...
HP:0001304	Torsion dystonia	扭转性肌张力障碍	Sustained involuntary muscle contractions that produce twisting and repetitive movements of the body.	校对中...
HP:0001305	Dandy-Walker malformation	第四脑室孔闭塞综合征（Dandy-Walker畸形）	A congenital brain malformation typically characterized by incomplete formation of the cerebellar vermis, dilation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa. In layman's terms, Dandy Walker malformation is a cyst in the cerebellum (typically symmetrical) that is involved with the fourth ventricle. This may interfere with the ability to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain, resulting in hydrocephalus. Dandy Walker cysts are formed during early embryonic development, while the brain forms. The cyst in the cerebellum typically has several blood vessels running through it connecting to the brain, thereby prohibiting surgical removal.	校对中...
HP:0001308	Tongue fasciculations	舌肌束震颤	Fasciculations or fibrillation affecting the tongue muscle.	校对中...
HP:0001310	Dysmetria	辨距不良	A type of ataxia characterized by the inability to carry out movements with the correct range and motion across the plane of more than one joint related to incorrect estimation of the distances required for targeted movements.	校对中...
HP:0001311	Abnormal nervous system electrophysiology	神经系统电生理学异常	An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles as measured by electrophysiological investigations.	校对中...
HP:0001312	Giant somatosensory evoked potentials	巨大的体感诱发电位	An abnormal enlargement (i.e. increase in measured voltage) of somatosensory evoked potentials.	校对中...
HP:0001315	Reduced tendon reflexes	腱反射减低	Diminution of tendon reflexes, which is an invariable sign of peripheral nerve disease.	校对中...
HP:0001317	Abnormal cerebellum morphology	小脑形态异常	Any structural abnormality of the cerebellum.	校对中...
HP:0001319	Neonatal hypotonia	新生儿肌张力减退	Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period.	校对中...
HP:0001320	Cerebellar vermis hypoplasia	小脑蚓部发育不全	Underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.	校对中...
HP:0001321	Cerebellar hypoplasia	小脑发育不全	Cerebellar hypoplasia is a descriptive term implying a cerebellum with a reduced volume, but a normal shape and is stable over time.	校对中...
HP:0001324	Muscle weakness	肌无力	Reduced strength of muscles.	校对中...
HP:0001325	Hypoglycemic coma	低血糖昏迷		
HP:0001326	EEG with irregular generalized spike and wave complexes	脑电图，不规则的全面性棘慢复合波	EEG shows spikes (<80 ms) and waves, which are recorded over the entire scalp and do not have a specific frequency.	校对中...
HP:0001327	Photosensitive myoclonic seizure	光敏性肌阵挛发作	Generalised myoclonic seizure provoked by flashing or flickering light.	校对中...
HP:0001328	Specific learning disability	特定的学习障碍	Impairment of certain skills such as reading or writing, coordination, self-control, or attention that interfere with the ability to learn. The impairment is not related to a global deficiency of intelligence.	校对中...
HP:0001331	Absent septum pellucidum	透明隔缺如	Absence of the septum pellucidum.	校对中...
HP:0001332	Dystonia	肌张力障碍	An abnormally increased muscular tone that causes fixed abnormal postures. There is a slow, intermittent twisting motion that leads to exaggerated turning and posture of the extremities and trunk.	校对中...
HP:0001334	Communicating hydrocephalus	交通性脑积水	A form of hydrocephalus in which there is no visible obstruction to the flow of the cerebrospinal fluid between the ventricles and subarachnoid space.	校对中...
HP:0001335	Bimanual synkinesia	双手联带运动	Involuntary movements of one hand that accompany and mirror intentional movements of the opposite hand.	校对中...
HP:0001336	Myoclonus	肌阵挛	Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.	校对中...
HP:0001337	Tremor	震颤	An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement about a joint axis.	校对中...
HP:0001338	Partial agenesis of the corpus callosum	局部胼胝体发育不全	A partial failure of the development of the corpus callosum.	校对中...
HP:0001339	Lissencephaly	无脑回畸形	A spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration that subsumes the terms agyria, pachygyria and subcortical band heterotopia. See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.	校对中...
HP:0001340	Enhancement of the C-reflex	C-反射增强	Increase in amplitude of a long-loop response upon somatosensory evoked potential testing, representing an electrically evoked myoclonic response.	校对中...
HP:0001341	Olfactory lobe agenesis	嗅叶不发育		
HP:0001342	Cerebral hemorrhage	脑出血	Hemorrhage into the parenchyma of the brain.	校对中...
HP:0001343	Kernicterus	核黄疸	Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.	校对中...
HP:0001344	Absent speech	语言丧失	Complete lack of development of speech and language abilities.	校对中...
HP:0001345	Psychotic mentation	精神心理状态		
HP:0001347	Hyperreflexia	反射亢进	Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles.	校对中...
HP:0001348	Brisk reflexes	反射活跃	Tendon reflexes that are noticeably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examination). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal.	校对中...
HP:0001349	Facial diplegia	双侧面瘫	Facial diplegia refers to bilateral facial palsy (bilateral facial palsy is much rarer than unilateral facial palsy).	校对中...
HP:0001350	Slurred speech	言语不清	Abnormal coordination of muscles involved in speech.	校对中...
HP:0001351	Jerk-locked premyoclonus spikes	抽动锁时的肌阵挛前棘波	Jerk-locked averaging (JLA) is used to record the timing and distribution of brain activity preceding brisk involuntary movements such as those observed in patients with myoclonus. JLA is capable of revealing a premyoclonus spike in the absence of paroxysmal activity in the routine EEG.	校对中...
HP:0001355	Megalencephaly	巨脑	Diffuse enlargement of the entire cerebral hemispheres leading to macrocephaly (with or without overlying cortical dysplasia).	校对中...
HP:0001357	Plagiocephaly	斜头畸形	Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.	校对中...
HP:0001360	Holoprosencephaly	前脑无裂畸形	Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.	校对中...
HP:0001361	Nystagmus-induced head nodding	眼球震颤诱导点头运动	Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.	校对中...
HP:0001362	Calvarial skull defect	颅骨缺损	A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.	校对中...
HP:0001363	Craniosynostosis	颅缝早闭	Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.	校对中...
HP:0001367	Abnormal joint morphology	关节形态异常	An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.	校对中...

HP:0001371	Flexion contracture	屈曲挛缩	A flexion contracture is a bent (flexed) joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.	校对中...

HP:0001382	Joint hypermobility	关节过度活动	The ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion.	校对中...
HP:0001384	Abnormal hip joint morphology	髋关节形态异常	An abnormality of the hip joint.	校对中...

HP:0001386	Joint swelling	关节肿胀		
HP:0001387	Joint stiffness	关节僵硬	Joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in a joint or joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity. Joint stiffness typically subsides over time.	校对中...
HP:0001388	Joint laxity	关节松弛	Lack of stability of a joint.	校对中...
HP:0001392	Abnormality of the liver	肝脏异常	An abnormality of the liver.	校对中...
HP:0001394	Cirrhosis	肝硬化	A chronic disorder of the liver in which liver tissue becomes scarred and is partially replaced by regenerative nodules and fibrotic tissue resulting in loss of liver function.	校对中...
HP:0001395	Hepatic fibrosis	肝纤维化	The presence of excessive fibrous connective tissue in the liver. Fibrosis is a reparative or reactive process.	校对中...
HP:0001396	Cholestasis	胆汁淤积	Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in bile ducts.	校对中...

HP:0001417	X-linked inheritance	X-连锁遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome.	校对中...
HP:0001419	X-linked recessive inheritance	X-连锁隐性遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.	校对中...
HP:0001421	Abnormality of the musculature of the hand	手部肌肉异常		
HP:0001423	X-linked dominant inheritance	X-连锁显性遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.	校对中...
HP:0001425	Heterogeneous	异质性的		
HP:0001426	Multifactorial inheritance	多因素遗传	A mode of inheritance that depends on a mixture of major and minor genetic determinants possibly together with environmental factors. Diseases inherited in this manner are termed complex diseases.	校对中...
HP:0001427	Mitochondrial inheritance	线粒体遗传	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the mitochondrial genome. Because the mitochondrial genome is essentially always maternally inherited, a mitochondrial condition can only be transmitted by females, although the condition can affect both sexes. The proportion of mutant mitochondria can vary (heteroplasmy).	校对中...
HP:0001428	Somatic mutation	体细胞突变	A mode of inheritance in which a trait or disorder results from a de novo mutation occurring after conception, rather than being inherited from a preceding generation.

HP:0001488	Bilateral ptosis	双侧眼睑下垂		
HP:0001489	Posterior vitreous detachment	玻璃体后部脱离	Separation of the vitreous humor from the retina.	校对中...
HP:0001491	Congenital fibrosis of extraocular muscles	先天性眼外肌纤维化	Congenital non-progressive ophthalmoplegia with multiple extraocular muscle restrictions. Typically, there is ptosis and variable degrees of restriction of horizontal and vertical eye movements.	校对中...
HP:0001492	Axenfeld anomaly	Axenfeld 综合征	Axenfeld's anomaly is a bilateral disorder characterized by a prominent, anteriorly displaced Schwalbe's line (posterior embryotoxon) and peripheral iris strands which span the anterior chamber angle to attach to Schwalbe's line.	校对中...
HP:0001493	Falciform retinal fold	镰状视网膜皱襞	An area of the retina that is buckled so that a sector-shaped sheet of retina lies in front of the normal retina. This feature is of congenital onset.	校对中...
HP:0001495	Carpal osteolysis	腕骨溶骨	Osteolysis affecting carpal bones.	校对中...
HP:0001498	Carpal bone hypoplasia	腕骨骨发育不全	Underdevelopment of one or more carpal bones.	校对中...
HP:0001500	Broad finger	宽指	Increased width of a non-thumb digit of the hand.	校对中...
HP:0001501	6 metacarpals	6块掌骨

HP:0001507	Growth abnormality	生长异常		
HP:0001508	Failure to thrive	发育迟滞	Failure to thrive (FTT) refers to a child whose physical growth is substantially below the norm.	校对中...
HP:0001510	Growth delay	生长延迟	A deficiency or slowing down of growth pre- and postnatally.	校对中...
HP:0001511	Intrauterine growth retardation	胎儿宫内发育迟缓	An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.	校对中...
HP:0001513	Obesity	肥胖	Accumulation of substantial excess body fat.	校对中...
HP:0001518	Small for gestational age	小于胎龄儿	Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.	校对中...
HP:0001519	Disproportionate tall stature	不成比例的高身材	A tall and slim body build with increased arm span to height ratio (>1.05) and a reduced upper-to-lower segment ratio (<0.85), i.e., unusually long arms and legs. The extremities as well as the hands and feet are unusually slim.	校对中...
HP:0001520	Large for gestational age	大于胎龄儿	The term large for gestational age applies to babies whose birth weight lies above the 90th percentile for that gestational age.	校对中...
HP:0001522	Death in infancy	婴儿期夭折	Death within the first 24 months of life.	校对中...

HP:0001531	Failure to thrive in infancy	婴儿期生长障碍		
HP:0001533	Slender build	修长的身材	Asthenic habitus refers to a slender build with long limbs, an angular profile, and prominent muscles or bones.	校对中...
HP:0001537	Umbilical hernia	脐疝	Protrusion of abdominal contents through a defect in the abdominal wall musculature around the umbilicus. Skin and subcutaneous tissue overlie the defect.	校对中...
HP:0001538	Protuberant abdomen	腹部隆凸	A thrusting or bulging out of the abdomen.	校对中...
HP:0001539	Omphalocele	脐膨出	A midline anterior incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which there is herniation of the abdominal viscera into the base of the abdominal cord.	校对中...
HP:0001540	Diastasis recti	腹直肌分离	A separation of the rectus abdominis muscle into right and left halves (which are normally joined at the midline at the linea alba).	校对中...
HP:0001541	Ascites	腹水	Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.	校对中...
HP:0001543	Gastroschisis	腹裂	A type of congenital ventral incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which the intestines and sometimes other organs extend freely into the amniotic fluid space through a small opening in the abdomen, usually to the right of the umbilicus.	校对中...
HP:0001544	Prominent umbilicus	脐突出	Abnormally prominent umbilicus (belly button).	校对中...
HP:0001545	Anteriorly placed anus	肛门前置	Anterior malposition of the anus.	校对中...
HP:0001547	Abnormal rib cage morphology	胸廓形态异常	A morphological anomaly of the rib cage.	校对中...
HP:0001548	Overgrowth	过度生长	Excessive postnatal growth which may comprise increased weight, increased length, and/or increased head circumference.	校对中...
HP:0001549	Abnormal ileum morphology	回肠形态结构异常		
HP:0001551	Abnormal umbilicus morphology	脐形态结构异常	An abnormality of the structure or appearance of the umbilicus.	校对中...
HP:0001552	Barrel-shaped chest	桶状胸	A rounded, bulging chest that resembles the shape of a barrel. That is, there is an increased anteroposterior diameter and usually some degree of kyphosis.	校对中...

HP:0001561	Polyhydramnios	羊水过多	The presence of excess amniotic fluid in the uterus during pregnancy.	校对中...

HP:0001572	Macrodontia	巨牙	Increased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD above mean for age. Alternatively, an apparently increased maximum width of the tooth.	校对中...
HP:0001574	Abnormality of the integument	体壁的异常	An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.	校对中...
HP:0001579	Primary hypercortisolism	原发性皮质醇增多症	Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol.	校对中...
HP:0001580	Pigmented micronodular adrenocortical disease	色素性小结节状肾上腺皮质疾病		
HP:0001581	Recurrent skin infections	复发性皮肤感染	Infections of the skin that happen multiple times.	校对中...
HP:0001582	Redundant skin	赘肉	Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity.	校对中...
HP:0001583	Rotary nystagmus	旋转眼球震颤	A form of nystagmus in which the eyeball makes rotary motions around the axis.	校对中...
HP:0001586	Vesicovaginal fistula	膀胱阴道瘘	The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to the vagina.	校对中...
HP:0001591	Bell-shaped thorax	钟形胸	The rib cage has the shape of a wide mouthed bell. That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, followed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.	校对中...
HP:0001592	Selective tooth agenesis	选择性牙齿发育不全	Agenesis specifically affecting one of the classes incisor, premolar, or molar.	校对中...

HP:0001595	Abnormal hair morphology	毛发形态异常	An abnormality of the hair.	校对中...
HP:0001596	Alopecia	脱发	A noncongenital process of hair loss, which may progress to partial or complete baldness.	校对中...
HP:0001597	Abnormality of the nail	指（趾）甲异常	Abnormality of the nail.	校对中...
HP:0001598	Concave nail	反甲	The natural longitudinal (posterodistal) convex arch is not present or is inverted.	校对中...
HP:0001600	Abnormality of the larynx	喉部异常	An abnormality of the larynx.	校对中...
HP:0001601	Laryngomalacia	喉软骨软化	Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.	校对中...
HP:0001602	Laryngeal stenosis	喉狭窄	Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.	校对中...

HP:0001607	Subglottic stenosis	声门下狭窄		
HP:0001608	Abnormality of the voice	声音异常		
HP:0001609	Hoarse voice	声音嘶哑	Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.	校对中...

HP:0001612	Weak cry	哭声微弱

HP:0001622	Premature birth	早产	The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.	校对中...
HP:0001623	Breech presentation	臀先露	A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.	校对中...
HP:0001626	Abnormality of the cardiovascular system	心血管系统的任何异常、	Any abnormality of the cardiovascular system.	校对中...
HP:0001627	Abnormal heart morphology	心脏形态异常	Any structural anomaly of the heart.	校对中...
HP:0001629	Ventricular septal defect	室间隔缺损	A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.	校对中...
HP:0001631	Atrial septal defect	房间隔缺损	Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the interatrial septum that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.	校对中...
HP:0001633	Abnormal mitral valve morphology	二尖瓣形态异常	Any structural anomaly of the mitral valve.	校对中...
HP:0001634	Mitral valve prolapse	二尖瓣脱垂	One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001635	Congestive heart failure	充血性心力衰竭	The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.	校对中...
HP:0001636	Tetralogy of Fallot	法洛四联症	A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.	校对中...
HP:0001637	Abnormal myocardium morphology	心肌形态异常	A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall.	校对中...
HP:0001638	Cardiomyopathy	心肌病	A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.	校对中...
HP:0001639	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy	肥厚型心肌病	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality.	校对中...
HP:0001640	Cardiomegaly	心脏扩大	Increased size of the heart, clinically defined as an increased transverse diameter of the cardiac silhouette that is greater than or equal to 50% of the transverse diameter of the chest (increased cardiothoracic ratio) on a posterior-anterior projection of a chest radiograph or a computed tomography.	校对中...
HP:0001641	Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology	肺动脉瓣形态异常	Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.	校对中...
HP:0001642	Pulmonic stenosis	肺动脉狭窄	A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis) or just below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis).	校对中...
HP:0001643	Patent ductus arteriosus	动脉导管未闭	In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.	校对中...
HP:0001644	Dilated cardiomyopathy	扩张型心肌病	Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis.	校对中...
HP:0001645	Sudden cardiac death	心脏性猝死	The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset).	校对中...
HP:0001646	Abnormal aortic valve morphology	主动脉瓣形态异常	Any abnormality of the aortic valve.	校对中...
HP:0001647	Bicuspid aortic valve	二叶主动脉瓣	The presence of an aortic valve with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps). Bicuspid aortic valvue is a malformation of a commissure (small space between the attachment of each cusp to the aortic wall) and the adjacent parts of the two corresponding cusps forming a raphe (the fused area of the two underdeveloped cusps turning into a malformed commissure between both cusps; the raphe is a fibrous ridge that extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps).	校对中...
HP:0001648	Cor pulmonale	肺源性心脏病	Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001649	Tachycardia	心动过速	A rapid heartrate that exceeds the range of the normal resting heartrate for age.	校对中...
HP:0001650	Aortic valve stenosis	主动脉瓣狭窄	The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.	校对中...
HP:0001651	Dextrocardia	右位心	The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left.	校对中...
HP:0001653	Mitral regurgitation	二尖瓣反流	An abnormality of the mitral valve characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.	校对中...
HP:0001654	Abnormal heart valve morphology	心脏瓣膜形态异常	Any structural abnormality of a cardiac valve.	校对中...
HP:0001655	Patent foramen ovale	卵圆孔未闭	Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.	校对中...
HP:0001657	Prolonged QT interval	QT间期延长	Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).	校对中...
HP:0001658	Myocardial infarction	心肌梗死	Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.	校对中...
HP:0001659	Aortic regurgitation	主动脉瓣反流	An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001660	Truncus arteriosus	动脉干	A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.	校对中...
HP:0001662	Bradycardia	心动过缓	A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).	校对中...
HP:0001663	Ventricular fibrillation	心室纤颤	Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.	校对中...
HP:0001664	Torsade de pointes	尖端扭转型室性心动过速	A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.	校对中...
HP:0001667	Right ventricular hypertrophy	右心室肥厚	In this case the right ventricle is more muscular than normal, causing a characteristic boot-shaped (coeur-en-sabot) appearance as seen on anterior- posterior chest x-rays. Right ventricular hypertrophy is commonly associated with any form of right ventricular outflow obstruction or pulmonary hypertension, which may in turn owe its origin to left-sided disease. The echocardiographic signs are thickening of the anterior right ventricular wall and the septum. Cavity size is usually normal, or slightly enlarged. In many cases there is associated volume overload present due to tricuspid regurgitation, in the absence of this, septal motion is normal.	校对中...
HP:0001669	Transposition of the great arteries	大动脉转位	A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001670	Asymmetric septal hypertrophy	非对称性心室间隔肥厚	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.	校对中...
HP:0001671	Abnormal cardiac septum morphology	心脏间隔异常	An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.	校对中...
HP:0001674	Complete atrioventricular canal defect	完全性房室通道缺损	A congenital heart defect characterized by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.	校对中...
HP:0001677	Coronary artery atherosclerosis	冠状动脉粥样硬化	Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.	校对中...
HP:0001678	Atrioventricular block	房室传导阻滞	Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.	校对中...
HP:0001679	Abnormal aortic morphology	主动脉形态异常	An abnormality of the aorta.	校对中...
HP:0001680	Coarctation of aorta	主动脉缩窄	Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.	校对中...
HP:0001681	Angina pectoris	心绞痛	Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.	校对中...
HP:0001682	Subvalvular aortic stenosis	主动脉瓣下狭窄	A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.	校对中...
HP:0001683	Ectopia cordis	心脏异位	Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall.	校对中...
HP:0001684	Secundum atrial septal defect	第二房间隔缺损	A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.	校对中...
HP:0001685	Myocardial fibrosis	心肌纤维化	Myocardial fibrosis is characterized by dysregulated collagen turnover (increased synthesis predominates over unchanged or decreased degradation) and excessive diffuse collagen accumulation in the interstitial and perivascular spaces as well as by phenotypically transformed fibroblasts, termed myofibroblasts.	校对中...
HP:0001686	Loss of voice	失声		
HP:0001688	Sinus bradycardia	窦性心动过缓	Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.	校对中...
HP:0001691	Muscular subvalvular aortic stenosis	肌性主动脉瓣下狭窄	A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow through the left-ventricular outflow tract.	校对中...
HP:0001692	Atrial arrhythmia	房性心律不齐	A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.	校对中...
HP:0001693	Cardiac shunt	心脏分流	Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.	校对中...
HP:0001694	Right-to-left shunt	右向左分流	Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left.	校对中...
HP:0001695	Cardiac arrest	心脏骤停	An abrupt loss of heart function.	校对中...
HP:0001696	Situs inversus totalis	全内脏反位	A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs.	校对中...
HP:0001697	Abnormal pericardium morphology	心包形态异常	An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.	校对中...
HP:0001698	Pericardial effusion	心包积液	Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.	校对中...
HP:0001699	Sudden death	猝死	Rapid and unexpected death.	校对中...
HP:0001700	Myocardial necrosis	心肌坏死	Irreversible damage to heart tissue (myocardium) due to lack of oxygen after a heart attack (myocardial infarction).	校对中...
HP:0001701	Pericarditis	心包炎	Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).	校对中...
HP:0001702	Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology	三尖瓣形态异常	Any structural anomaly of the tricuspid valve.	校对中...
HP:0001704	Tricuspid valve prolapse	三尖瓣脱垂	One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001705	Right ventricular outlet tract obstruction	右室流出道梗阻	An obstruction to the forward flow of blood in the outflow tract of the right ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001706	Endocardial fibroelastosis	心内膜弹力纤维增生症	Diffuse thickening of the ventricular endocardium and by associated myocardial dysfunction	校对中...
HP:0001707	Abnormal right ventricle morphology	右心室形态异常	An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart.	校对中...
HP:0001708	Right ventricular failure	右心衰竭	Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading to pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly.	校对中...
HP:0001709	Third degree atrioventricular block	三度房室传导阻滞	Third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block (also referred to as complete heart block) is the complete dissociation of the atria and the ventricles. Third-degree AV block exists when more P waves than QRS complexes exist and no relationship (no conduction) exists between them.	校对中...
HP:0001710	Conotruncal defect	圆锥动脉干缺损	A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001711	Abnormal left ventricle morphology	左心室形态异常	Any structural abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart.	校对中...
HP:0001712	Left ventricular hypertrophy	左心室肥厚	Enlargement or increased size of the heart left ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001713	Abnormal cardiac ventricle morphology	心室形态异常	An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001714	Ventricular hypertrophy	心室肥厚	Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.	校对中...
HP:0001716	Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome	预激综合征	A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.	校对中...
HP:0001717	Coronary artery calcification	冠状动脉钙化	An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a coronary artery.	校对中...
HP:0001718	Mitral stenosis	二尖瓣狭窄	An abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve.	校对中...
HP:0001719	Double outlet right ventricle	右室双出口	Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.	校对中...
HP:0001722	High-output congestive heart failure	高输出充血性心力衰竭	A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.	校对中...
HP:0001723	Restrictive cardiomyopathy	限制型心肌病	Restrictive left ventricular physiology is characterized by a pattern of ventricular filling in which increased stiffness of the myocardium causes ventricular pressure to rise precipitously with only small increases in volume, defined as restrictive ventricular physiology in the presence of normal or reduced diastolic volumes (of one or both ventricles), normal or reduced systolic volumes, and normal ventricular wall thickness.	校对中...
HP:0001727	Thromboembolic stroke	血栓栓塞性脑卒中	A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.	校对中...

HP:0001735	Acute pancreatitis	急性胰腺炎	A acute form of pancreatitis.	校对中...

HP:0001747	Accessory spleen	副脾	An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.	校对中...
HP:0001748	Polysplenia	多脾	Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.	校对中...

HP:0001761	Pes cavus	高弓足	The presence of an unusually high plantar arch. Also called high instep, pes cavus refers to a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight.	校对中...
HP:0001762	Talipes equinovarus	马蹄内翻足	Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.	校对中...
HP:0001763	Pes planus	扁平足	A foot where the longitudinal arch of the foot is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.	校对中...
HP:0001765	Hammertoe	槌状趾	Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.	校对中...
HP:0001769	Broad foot	宽足	A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.	校对中...
HP:0001770	Toe syndactyly	并趾	Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".	校对中...

HP:0001884	Talipes calcaneovalgus	跟骨畸形	Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an "up and out" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg.	校对中...

HP:0001902	Giant platelets	巨血小板	Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. HP:0001908	Hypoplastic anemia	发育不良性贫血	Anemia with varying degrees of erythrocytic hypoplasia without leukopenia or thrombocytopenia.	校对中...

HP:0001911	Abnormal granulocyte morphology	粒细胞形态异常	Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of granulocytes.	校对中...

HP:0001913	Granulocytopenia	粒细胞减少症	An abnormally reduced number of granulocytes in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0001915	Aplastic anemia	再生障碍性贫血	Aplastic anemia is defined as pancytopenia with a hypocellular marrow.	校对中...
HP:0001917	Renal amyloidosis	肾淀粉样病变	A form of amyloidosis that affects the kidney. On hematoxylin and eosin stain, amyloid is identified as extracellular amorphous material that is lightly eosinophilic. These deposits often stain weakly for periodic acid Schiff (PAS), demonstrate a blue-to-gray hue on the trichrome stain and are typically negative on the Jones methenamine silver (JMS) stain. These tinctorial properties contrast with the histologic appearance of collagen, a major component of basement membranes, mesangial matrix and areas of sclerosis, which demonstrates strong positivity for PAS and JMS (See Figure 1 of PMID:25852856).	校对中...
HP:0001919	Acute kidney injury	急性肾损伤	Sudden loss of renal function, as manifested by decreased urine production, and a rise in serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen concentration (azotemia).	校对中...

HP:0001923	Reticulocytosis	网织红细胞增多症	An elevation in the number of reticulocytes (immature erythrocytes) in the peripheral blood circulation.	校对中...
HP:0001924	Sideroblastic anemia	铁粒幼细胞性贫血	Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining).	校对中...
HP:0001927	Acanthocytosis	棘形红细胞增多症	Acanthocytosis is a type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shape resembling many-pointed stars.	校对中...
HP:0001928	Abnormality of coagulation	凝血异常	An abnormality of the process of blood coagulation. That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot.	校对中...
HP:0001929	Reduced factor XI activity	凝血因子XI活性减低	Decreased activity of coagulation factor XI. Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine proteinase that activates factor IX.	校对中...

HP:0001942	Metabolic acidosis	代谢性酸中毒	Metabolic acidosis (MA) is characterized by a fall in blood pH due to a reduction of serum bicarbonate concentration. This can occur as a result of either the accumulation of acids (high anion gap MA) or the loss of bicarbonate from the gastrointestinal tract or the kidney (hyperchloremic MA). By definition, MA is not due to a respirary cause.	校对中...
HP:0001943	Hypoglycemia	低血糖	A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0001944	Dehydration	脱水		
HP:0001945	Fever	发热	Body temperature elevated above the normal range.	校对中...
HP:0001946	Ketosis	酮症	Presence of elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.	校对中...
HP:0001947	Renal tubular acidosis	肾小管性酸中毒	Acidosis owing to malfunction of the kidney tubules with accumulation of metabolic acids and hyperchloremia, potentially leading to complications including hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria, nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis.	校对中...
HP:0001948	Alkalosis	碱中毒	Depletion of acid or accumulation base in the body fluids.	校对中...
HP:0001949	Hypokalemic alkalosis	低钾性碱中毒

HP:0001951	Episodic ammonia intoxication	阵发性氨中毒		
HP:0001952	Glucose intolerance	糖耐量异常	Glucose intolerance (GI) can be defined as dysglycemia that comprises both prediabetes and diabetes. It includes the conditions of impaired fasting glucose (IFG) and impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) and diabetes mellitus (DM).	校对中...
HP:0001953	Diabetic ketoacidosis	糖尿病酮症酸中毒	A type of diabetic metabolic abnormality with an accumulation of ketone bodies.	校对中...

HP:0001982	Sea-blue histiocytosis	海蓝色组织细胞增多症	An abnormality of histiocytes, in which the cells take on a sea blue appearance due to abnormally increased lipid content. Histiocytes are a type of macrophage. Sea-blue histiocytes are typically large macrophages from 20 to 60 micrometers in diameter with a single eccentric nucleus whose cytoplasm if packed with sea-blue or blue-green granules when stained with Wright-Giemsa.	校对中...

HP:0002017	Nausea and vomiting	恶心和呕吐	Nausea is a commonly encountered symptom that has been defined as an unpleasant painless subjective feeling that one will imminently vomit. Vomiting has been defined as the forceful expulsion of the contents of the stomach, duodenum, or jejunum through the oral cavity. While nausea and vomiting are often thought to exist on a temporal continuum, this is not always the case. There are situations when severe nausea may be present without emesis and less frequently, when emesis may be present without preceding nausea.	校对中...

HP:0002044	Zollinger-Ellison syndrome	Zollinger-Ellison 综合征	A condition in which there is increased production of gastrin by a gastrin-secreting tumor (usually located in the pancreas, duodenum, or abdominal lymph nodes) that stimulates the gastric mucosa to maximal activity, with consequent gastrointestinal mucosal ulceration.	校对中...
HP:0002045	Hypothermia	低体温	Reduced body temperature due to failed thermoregulation.	校对中...

HP:0002047	Malignant hyperthermia	恶性高热	Malignant hyperthermia is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C in response to inhalational anesthetics such as halothane or to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine.	校对中...

HP:0002062	Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract	锥体束的形态异常	Any structural abnormality of the pyramidal tract, whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.	校对中...
HP:0002063	Rigidity	强直	Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.	校对中...
HP:0002064	Spastic gait	痉挛步态	Spasticity is manifested by increased stretch reflex which is intensified with movement velocity. This results in excessive and inappropriate muscle activation which can contribute to muscle hypertonia. Spastic gait is characterized by manifestations such as muscle hypertonia, stiff knee, and circumduction of the leg.	校对中...
HP:0002066	Gait ataxia	共济失调步态	A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to coordinate the movements required for normal walking. Gait ataxia is characteirzed by a wide-based staggering gait with a tendency to fall.	校对中...
HP:0002067	Bradykinesia	运动迟缓	Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).	校对中...
HP:0002068	Neuromuscular dysphagia	神经肌肉源性吞咽困难		
HP:0002069	Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure	双侧强直- 阵挛发作	A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure is a seizure defined by a tonic (bilateral increased tone, lasting seconds to minutes) and then a clonic (bilateral sustained rhythmic jerking) phase.	校对中...
HP:0002070	Limb ataxia	肢体共济失调	A kind of ataxia that affects movements of the extremities.	校对中...
HP:0002071	Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function	锥体外系功能障碍	A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).	校对中...
HP:0002072	Chorea	舞蹈样运动	Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion. It is a random-appearing sequence of one or more discrete involuntary movements or movement fragments. Movements appear random because of variability in timing, duration or location. Each movement may have a distinct start and end. However, movements may be strung together and thus may appear to flow randomly from one muscle group to another. Chorea can involve the trunk, neck, face, tongue, and extremities.	校对中...
HP:0002073	Progressive cerebellar ataxia	进行性小脑共济失调		
HP:0002074	Increased neuronal autofluorescent lipopigment	神经元自体荧光脂褐素增加	Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.	校对中...
HP:0002075	Dysdiadochokinesis	轮替运动障碍	A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as pronating and supinating his or her hand on the dorsum of the other hand as rapidly as possible.	校对中...
HP:0002076	Migraine	偏头痛	Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.	校对中...
HP:0002077	Migraine with aura	有先兆偏头痛	A type of migraine in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.	校对中...
HP:0002078	Truncal ataxia	躯干性共济失调	Truncal ataxia is a sign of ataxia characterized by instability of the trunk. It usually occurs during sitting.	校对中...
HP:0002079	Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum	胼胝体发育不良	Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.	校对中...
HP:0002080	Intention tremor	意向性震颤	A type of kinetic tremor that occurs during target directed movement is called intention tremor. That is, an oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient's nose or a physician's finger).	校对中...
HP:0002083	Migraine without aura	无先兆偏头痛	Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.	校对中...
HP:0002084	Encephalocele	脑膨出	A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.	校对中...
HP:0002085	Occipital encephalocele	枕部脑膨出	A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.	校对中...
HP:0002086	Abnormality of the respiratory system	呼吸系统异常	An abnormality of the respiratory system, which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles.	校对中...
HP:0002087	Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract	上呼吸道异常	An abnormality of the upper respiratory tract.	校对中...
HP:0002088	Abnormal lung morphology	肺部形态异常	Any structural anomaly of the lung.	校对中...
HP:0002089	Pulmonary hypoplasia	肺发育不良		
HP:0002090	Pneumonia	肺炎	Inflammation of any part of the lung parenchyma.	校对中...
HP:0002091	Restrictive ventilatory defect	限制性通气功能障碍	A functional defect characterized by reduced total lung capacity (TLC) not associated with abnormalities of expiratory airflow or airway resistance. Spirometrically, a restrictive defect is defined as FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in 1 second) and FVC (forced vital capacity) less than 80 per cent. Restrictive lung disease may be caused by alterations in lung parenchyma or because of a disease of the pleura, chest wall, or neuromuscular apparatus.	校对中...
HP:0002092	Pulmonary arterial hypertension	肺动脉高压	Pulmonary hypertension is defined mean pulmonary artery pressure of 25mmHg or more and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 15mmHg or less when measured by right heart catheterisation at rest and in a supine position.	校对中...
HP:0002093	Respiratory insufficiency	呼吸功能不全		
HP:0002094	Dyspnea	呼吸困难	Difficult or labored breathing. Dyspnea is a subjective feeling only the patient can rate, e.g., on a Borg scale.	校对中...
HP:0002097	Emphysema	气肿		
HP:0002098	Respiratory distress	呼吸窘迫	Respiratory distress is objectively observable as the physical or emotional consequences from the experience of dyspnea. The physical presentation of respiratory distress is generally referred to as labored breathing, while the sensation of respiratory distress is called shortness of breath or dyspnea.	校对中...
HP:0002099	Asthma	哮喘	Asthma is characterized by increased responsiveness of the tracheobronchial tree to multiple stimuli, leading to narrowing of the air passages with resultant dyspnea, cough, and wheezing.	校对中...
HP:0002100	Recurrent aspiration pneumonia	反复吸入性肺炎	Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.	校对中...
HP:0002101	Abnormal lung lobation	肺分叶异常	A developmental defect in the formation of pulmonary lobes.	校对中...
HP:0002102	Pleuritis	胸膜炎	Inflammation of the pleura.	校对中...
HP:0002103	Abnormal pleura morphology	胸膜异常	An abnormality of the pulmonary pleura, the thin, transparent membrane which covers the lungs and lines the inside of the chest walls.	校对中...
HP:0002104	Apnea	呼吸暂停	Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event.	校对中...
HP:0002105	Hemoptysis	咯血	Coughing up (expectoration) of blood or blood-streaked sputum from the larynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs.	校对中...
HP:0002107	Pneumothorax	气胸	Accumulation of air in the pleural cavity leading to a partially or completely collapsed lung.	校对中...
HP:0002108	Spontaneous pneumothorax	自发性气胸	Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.	校对中...
HP:0002110	Bronchiectasis	支气管扩张	Persistent abnormal dilatation of the bronchi owing to localized and irreversible destruction and widening of the large airways.	校对中...
HP:0002113	Pulmonary infiltrates	肺浸润		
HP:0002118	Abnormal cerebral ventricle morphology	脑室形态异常	Any structural abnormality of the cerebral ventricles.	校对中...
HP:0002119	Ventriculomegaly	巨脑室	An increase in size of the ventricular system of the brain.	校对中...
HP:0002120	Cerebral cortical atrophy	大脑皮层萎缩	Atrophy of the cortex of the cerebrum.	校对中...
HP:0002121	Generalized non-motor (absence) seizure	失神发作	A generalized non-motor (absence) seizure is a type of a type of dialeptic seizure that is of electrographically generalized onset. It is a generalized seizure characterised by an interruption of activities, a blank stare, and usually the person will be unresponsive when spoken to. Any ictal motor phenomena are minor in comparison to these non-motor features.	校对中...
HP:0002123	Generalized myoclonic seizure	全面性肌阵挛发作	A generalized myoclonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by bilateral, sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.	校对中...
HP:0002126	Polymicrogyria	多小脑回	Polymicrogyria is a congenital malformation of the cerebral cortex characterized by abnormal cortical layering (lamination) and an excessive number of small gyri (folds).	校对中...
HP:0002127	Abnormal upper motor neuron morphology	上运动神经元形态异常	Any structural anomaly that affects the upper motor neuron.	校对中...
HP:0002131	Episodic ataxia	发作性共济失调	Periodic spells of incoordination and imbalance, that is, episodes of ataxia typically lasting from 10 minutes to several hours or days.	校对中...
HP:0002132	Porencephalic cyst	脑穿通性囊肿	A cavity within the cerebral hemisphere, filled with cerebrospinal fluid, that communicates directly with the ventricular system.	校对中...
HP:0002133	Status epilepticus	癫痫持续状态	Status epilepticus is a type of prolonged seizure resulting either from the failure of the mechanisms responsible for seizure termination or from the initiation of mechanisms which lead to abnormally prolonged seizures (after time point t1). It is a condition that can have long-term consequences (after time point t2), including neuronal death, neuronal injury, and alteration of neuronal networks, depending on the type and duration of seizures.	校对中...
HP:0002134	Abnormality of the basal ganglia	基底节异常	Abnormality of the basal ganglia.	校对中...
HP:0002135	Basal ganglia calcification	基底节钙化	The presence of calcium deposition affecting one or more structures of the basal ganglia.	校对中...
HP:0002136	Broad-based gait	宽基步态	An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.	校对中...
HP:0002138	Subarachnoid hemorrhage	蛛网膜下腔出血	Hemorrhage occurring between the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.	校对中...
HP:0002139	Arrhinencephaly	无鼻无脑畸形		
HP:0002140	Ischemic stroke	缺血性脑卒中	Acute ischemic stroke (AIS) is defined by the sudden loss of blood flow to an area of the brain with the resulting loss of neurologic function. It is caused by thrombosis or embolism that occludes a cerebral vessel supplying a specific area of the brain. During a vessel occlusion, there is a core area where damage to the brain is irreversible and an area of penumbra where the brain has lost function owing to decreased blood flow but is not irreversibly injured.	校对中...
HP:0002141	Gait imbalance	步态失平衡		
HP:0002143	Abnormality of the spinal cord	脊髓异常	An abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon).	校对中...
HP:0002144	Tethered cord	脊髓栓系	During normal embryological development, the spinal cord first occupies the entire length of the vertebral column but goes on to assume a position at the level of L1 due to differential growth of the conus medullaris and the vertebral column. The filum terminale is a slender, threadlike structure that remains after the normal regression of the distal embryonic spinal cord and attaches the spinal cord to the coccyx. A tethered cord results if there is a thickened rope-like filum terminale which anchors the cord at the level of L2 or below, potentially causing neurologic signs owing to abnormal tension on the spinal cord.	校对中...
HP:0002145	Frontotemporal dementia	额颞叶痴呆	A dementia associated with degeneration of the frontotemporal lobe and clinically associated with personality and behavioral changes such as disinhibition, apathy, and lack of insight. The hallmark feature of frontotemporal dementia is the presentation with focal syndromes such as progressive language dysfunction, or aphasia, or behavioral changes characteristic of frontal lobe disorders.	校对中...
HP:0002148	Hypophosphatemia	低磷血症	An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0002149	Hyperuricemia	高尿酸血症	An abnormally high level of uric acid in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0002150	Hypercalciuria	高钙尿症		
HP:0002151	Increased serum lactate	血清乳酸增高	Abnormally increased level of blood lactate (2-hydroxypropanoic acid). Lactate is produced from pyruvate by lactate dehydrogenase during normal metabolism. The terms lactate and lactic acid are often used interchangeably but lactate (the component measured in blood) is strictly a weak base whereas lactic acid is the corresponding acid. Lactic acidosis is often used clinically to describe elevated lactate but should be reserved for cases where there is a corresponding acidosis (pH below 7.35).	校对中...
HP:0002152	Hyperproteinemia	高蛋白血症	An increased concentration of proteins in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0002153	Hyperkalemia	高钾血症	An abnormally increased potassium concentration in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0002154	Hyperglycinemia	高甘氨酸血症	An elevated concentration of glycine in the blood.	校对中...
HP:0002155	Hypertriglyceridemia	高甘油三酯血症	An abnormal increase in the level of triglycerides in the blood.	校对中...

HP:0002167	Neurological speech impairment	神经语言障碍		
HP:0002168	Scanning speech	断续言语	An abnormal pattern of speech in which the words are as if measured or scanned; there is a pause after every syllable, and the syllables themselves are pronounced slowly.	校对中...
HP:0002169	Clonus	阵挛	A series of rhythmic and involuntary muscle contractions (at a frequency of about 5 to 7 Hz) that occur in response to an abruptly applied and sustained stretch.	校对中...
HP:0002170	Intracranial hemorrhage	颅内出血	Hemorrhage occurring within the skull.	校对中...
HP:0002171	Gliosis	胶质细胞增生	Gliosis is the focal proliferation of glial cells in the central nervous system.	校对中...
HP:0002172	Postural instability	姿势不稳	A tendency to fall or the inability to keep oneself from falling; imbalance. The retropulsion test is widely regarded as the gold standard to evaluate postural instability, Use of the retropulsion test includes a rapid balance perturbation in the backward direction, and the number of balance correcting steps (or total absence thereof) is used to rate the degree of postural instability. Healthy subjects correct such perturbations with either one or two large steps, or without taking any steps, hinging rapidly at the hips while swinging the arms forward as a counterweight. In patients with balance impairment, balance correcting steps are often too small, forcing patients to take more than two steps. Taking three or more steps is generally considered to be abnormal, and taking more than five steps is regarded as being clearly abnormal. Markedly affected patients continue to step backward without ever regaining their balance and must be caught by the examiner (this would be called true retropulsion). Even more severely affected patients fail to correct entirely, and fall backward like a pushed toy soldier, without taking any corrective steps.	校对中...
HP:0002173	Hypoglycemic seizures	低血糖发作		
HP:0002174	Postural tremor	姿势性震颤	A type of tremors that is triggered by holding a limb in a fixed position.	校对中...

Patients have difficulty chewing, swallowing and demonstrate slurred speech (often initial presentation) as well as abnormal behavioral symptoms such as inappropriate emotional outbursts of uncontrolled laughter or weeping etc.	校对中...

Usually the embolus is a blood clot that has developed in an extremity (for instance, a deep venous thrombosis), detached, and traveled through the circulation before becoming trapped in the pulmonary artery.	校对中...
HP:0002205	Recurrent respiratory infections	反复呼吸道感染	An increased susceptibility to respiratory infections as manifested by a history of recurrent respiratory infections.	校对中...

HP:0002224	Woolly hair	羊毛状发	The term woolly hair refers to an abnormal variant of hair that is fine, with tightly coiled curls, and often hypopigmented. Optical microscopy may reveal the presence of tight spirals and a clear diameter reduction as compared with normal hair. Electron microscopy may show flat, oval hair shafts with reduced transversal diameter.	校对中...

HP:0002249	Melena	黑便	The passage of blackish, tarry feces associated with gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Melena occurs if the blood remains in the colon long enough for it to be broken down by colonic bacteria. One degradation product, hematin, imbues the stool with a blackish color. Thus, melena generally occurs with bleeding from the upper gastrointestinal tract (e.g., stomach ulcers or duodenal ulcers), since the blood usually remains in the gut for a longer period of time than with lower gastrointestinal bleeding.	校对中...
HP:0002250	Abnormal large intestine morphology	大肠形态异常	Any abnormality of the large intestine.	校对中...

HP:0002305	Athetosis	手足徐动症	A slow, continuous, involuntary writhing movement that prevents maintenance of a stable posture. Athetosis involves continuous smooth movements that appear random and are not composed of recognizable sub-movements or movement fragments. In contrast to chorea, in athetosis, the same regions of the body are repeatedly involved. Athetosis may worsen with attempts at movement of posture, but athetosis can also occur at rest.	校对中...

HP:0002370	Poor coordination	协调能力下降		
HP:0002371	Loss of speech	言语不能		
HP:0002372	Normal interictal EEG	发作间期正常脑电图	Lack of observable abnormal electroencephalographic (EEG) patterns in an individual with a history of seizures. About half of individuals with epilepsy show interictal epileptiform discharges upon the first investigation. The yield can be increased by repeated studies, sleep studies, or by ambulatory EEG recordings over 24 hours. Normal interictal EEG is a sign that can be useful in the differential diagnosis.	校对中...
HP:0002373	Febrile seizure (within the age range of 3 months to 6 years)	高热惊厥(年龄在3个月至6岁之间)	A febrile seizure is any type of seizure (most often a generalized tonic-clonic seizure) occurring with fever (at least 38 degrees Celsius) but in the absence of central nervous system infection, severe metabolic disturbance or other alternative precipitant in children between the ages of 3 months and 6 years.	校对中...
HP:0002374	Diminished movement	运动减少		
HP:0002375	Hypokinesia	运动减少	Abnormally diminished motor activity. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.	校对中...
HP:0002376	Developmental regression	发育倒退	Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones.	校对中...
HP:0002378	Hand tremor	手部震颤	An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting the hand.	校对中...
HP:0002380	Fasciculations	肌束震颤	Fasciculations are observed as small, local, involuntary muscle contractions (twitching) visible under the skin. Fasciculations result from increased irritability of an axon (which in turn is often a manifestation of disease of a motor neuron). This leads to sporadic discharges of all the muscle fibers controlled by the axon in isolation from other motor units.	校对中...
HP:0002381	Aphasia	失语症	An acquired language impairment of some or all of the abilities to produce or comprehend speech and to read or write.	校对中...
HP:0002383	Encephalitis	脑炎		
HP:0002384	Focal impaired awareness seizure	知觉受损的局灶性发作	Focal impaired awareness seizure (or focal seizure with impaired or lost awareness) is a type of focal-onset seizure characterized by some degree (which may be partial) of impairment of the person's awareness of themselves or their surroundings at any point during the seizure.	校对中...
HP:0002385	Paraparesis	下肢轻瘫	Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.	校对中...
HP:0002389	Cavum septum pellucidum	第五脑室	If the two laminae of the septum pellucidum are not fused then a fluid-filled space or cavum is present. The cavum septum pellucidum is present at birth but usually obliterates by the age of 3 to 6 months. It is up to 1cm in width and the walls are parallel. It is an enclosed space and is not part of the ventricular system or connected with the subarachnoid space.	校对中...
HP:0002390	Spinal arteriovenous malformation	脊髓动静脉畸形		
HP:0002392	EEG with polyspike wave complexes	脑电图，伴多棘慢复合波	The presence of complexes of repetitive spikes and waves in EEG.	校对中...
HP:0002395	Lower limb hyperreflexia	下肢腱反射亢进		
HP:0002396	Cogwheel rigidity	齿轮样强直	A type of rigidity in which a muscle responds with cogwheellike jerks to the use of constant force in bending the limb (i.e., it gives way in little, repeated jerks when the muscle is passively stretched).	校对中...
HP:0002398	Degeneration of anterior horn cells	前角细胞变性		
HP:0002401	Stroke-like episode	卒中样发作	No consensus exists on what a stroke-like episode is, but these episodes can be functionally defined as a new neurological deficit, occurring with or without the context of seizures, which last longer than 24 hours.	校对中...
HP:0002403	Positive Romberg sign	闭目难立征阳性	The patient stands with the feet placed together and balance and is asked to close his or her eyes. A loss of balance upon eye closure is a positive Romberg sign and is interpreted as indicating a deficit in proprioception.	校对中...
HP:0002404	Thickened superior cerebellar peduncle	小脑上脚增厚	Increased width of the superior cerebellar peduncle.	校对中...

HP:0002408	Cerebral arteriovenous malformation	脑动静脉畸形	An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the brain.	校对中...
HP:0002410	Aqueductal stenosis	中脑导水管狭窄	Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.	校对中...
HP:0002411	Myokymia	肌纤维颤搐	Myokymia consists of involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions that spread across the affected striated muscle.	校对中...
HP:0002414	Spina bifida	脊柱裂	Incomplete closure of the embryonic neural tube, whereby some vertebral arches remain unfused and open. The mildest form is spina bifida occulta, followed by meningocele and meningomyelocele.	校对中...
HP:0002415	Leukodystrophy	脑白质营养不良	Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes. Symmetric white matter involvement at MRI is a typical finding in patients with leukodystrophies.	校对中...
HP:0002416	Subependymal cysts	室管膜下囊肿	Cerebral cysts, usually located in the wall of the caudate nucleus or in the caudothalamic groove. They are found in up to 5.2% of all neonates, using transfontanellar ultrasound in the first days of life.	校对中...
HP:0002418	Abnormal midbrain morphology	中脑形态异常	An abnormality of the midbrain, which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.	校对中...
HP:0002419	Molar tooth sign on MRI	磁共振磨牙征	An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.	校对中...
HP:0002421	Poor head control	头部控制能力弱	Difficulty to maintain correct position of the head while standing or sitting.	校对中...

HP:0002427	Expressive aphasia	运动性失语	Impairment of expressive language and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.	校对中...

HP:0002444	Hypothalamic hamartoma	下丘脑错构瘤	The presence of a hamartoma of the hypothalamus.	校对中...
HP:0002445	Tetraplegia	四肢瘫	Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.	校对中...

HP:0002454	Eye of the tiger anomaly of globus pallidus	苍白球虎眼征	The presence, on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, of markedly low signal intensity if the globus pallidus that surrounds a central region of high signal intensity in the anteromedial globus pallidus, producing an eye-of-the-tiger appearance.	校对中...

Language abilities are substantially and quantifiably below age expectations.	校对中...
HP:0002464	Spastic dysarthria	痉挛性构音障碍	A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. Speech of affected individuals is slow, effortful, and has a harsh vocal quality.	校对中...

HP:0002483	Bulbar signs	球部体征

HP:0002488	Acute leukemia	急性白血病	A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).	校对中...
HP:0002490	Increased CSF lactate	脑脊液乳酸升高	Increased concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.	校对中...
